author: oluwatobiloba
title: Episode Six of my Experience in the Village (My Local Place of Worship).
body:
As a result of the fact that I now have to stay in the village, I also had to change my place of worship to the one in the village. 
It wasn't really convenient but I had to adjust a little bit since I was not ready to go through the stress of going to the city every worship day. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/rpq7m80q9y.jpg)
[Image Credit](https://www.tripadvisor.ie/ShowUserReviews-g1234132-d2307204-r284881900-St_Patrick_s_Cathedral-Parramatta_Greater_Sydney_New_South_Wales.html)

One thing I find different is the different level of orderliness found in the churches mentioned,  the church in the city is more orderly than the one over here in the village. 

However, there was something I saw that was really  surprising to me in the local church, I realized that the church is transparent to the extent that,  every  money obtained from the church offering and thite, will be publicly announced to the hearing of the entire church. 
We were having a mid-week program in the church and when I attended,  I realiz
root_title: Episode Six of my Experience in the Village (My Local Place of Worship).

author: oluwatobiloba
title: My Experience in the Village (Episode Five).
body:
Just sitting on a short piece of wood receiving some fresh air,  I thought about what I could share with my lovely friends and then it crossed my mind to share my experience with the vice principal of the village school where I work. 

I learnt that this young man came to this village to serve his nation and because the villagers loved him, just like they love every good teacher,  or maybe he didn't see any other job, so he decided to stay here and become one of the teachers. 
The school owners were glad to see that a corps member wanted to stay with them so they gave him the position of a vice principal.
 
 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/o1i8l1g21k.jpg)
[Image Source](https://www.voanews.com/a/private-schools-for-kenya-poor-sparl-controversy/2809200.html)

I have tried to studied him for sometime and then I notice that he likes to do almost every type of work,  whenever the school management is looking for someone to do something, he will quickly say he can do the job effectively. 
He does the job of a farm
root_title: My Experience in the Village (Episode Five).

author: oluwatobiloba
title: My Experience in the Village [Episode Four].
body:
The structures in the village are not really good,  the school structure however seem to be better when compared with the houses in the village because the houses are made with mud while the school building is made with cement block.
 
 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/2ujpayx9ed.jpg)

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/zq5a7y8t62.jpg)

However,  there is no window in the classrooms,  the only window in the school is the one in the staff room.
The only cemented ground in the school also, is the one in the staff room. 

Some of the teachers who finished their service year deemed it fit to cement two of the classrooms, it was a thoughtful idea as this will prevent the students from having dirty bags,  sandals and socks. 
I say a big kudos to the wonderful souls who have made this possible. 

Pictures were taken with my mobile phone. 
Thanks for coming around, I am @tobi.
I run a relationship show here every Saturday, you can send in your questions, stories or messages through Mail: adekunlemercy95@gmail.com
root_title: My Experience in the Village [Episode Four].

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The fact that you are from a poor family does not mean you should remain poor.
body:
You need to work hard in order to achieve what you want in life, some people are fortunate enough to come from a wealthy family where they do not have to work extra hard,  but this afternoon, my focus is for those of those who are not from a rich family. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/rm0uht1rz1.jpg)
[Image credit](http://www.fanpop.com/clubs/th%25CE%25B5-%25CF%2581%25C3%25B8%25E1%25B9%25BF%25CE%25B5r%25CF%2584y/images/29028642/title/poor-families-around-world-screencap)

Do not compare yourself to people who come from a rich family, remember that stealing is never an option, begging is not also an option,  build your reputation. 
As you work hard,  you also need to learn patience, remember that there is no short cut to success.

You might have a rough beginning, and you have to struggle on your own,  but once you have an ambition,  you will realize that waiting for anyone is never an option. See you at the top darlings. 
Thanks for coming around, I am @tobi.
root_title: The fact that you are from a poor family does not mean you should remain poor.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Importance of Saying "Thank You".
body:
How often do you say thank you to those who have done something good for you. 
The human mind loves to apportion blames and fight for right at every little opportunity that they get, but it becomes a very difficult task to say thank you. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/lfdgb7wkxk.jpg)
[Image Source](https://www.secureteen.com/teaching-manners/teaching-your-teen-the-art-of-saying-thank-you/)

On so many occasions, all that some people want to hear is a simple thank you. 
Appreciation is very essential, it is not money,  it is not good,  silver or diamond, but it is really special to the heart .

A simple 'thank you might be all you need to save your marriage, save your friendship with that special person, save yourself from danger and the list is endless. 

I can go on and on about how important these words are,  but I will like you to constantly make use of them. 
Until I come your way again, I am @tobi.  Stay blessed.
root_title: The Importance of Saying "Thank You".

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The tounge: A useful and destructive instrument.
body:
The tounge happens to be a tiny part of the human body,  it could be very useful and destructive at the same time. 
The tounge is an instrument that can be used to create, it could as well be used to destroy the things that have been built for years. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/fs2ev3rczj.jpg)
[Image Credit](https://www.google.com.ng/amp/s/www.the-scientist.com/news-analysis/mining-the-mouths-many-microbes-37314/amp)

I think one thing that we as humans have the power over is the tounge,  we should be able to control the use and efficiency of our tounge since this little thing called tounge can ruin all we have. 
But sometimes some of this things cannot be done by our own will except we pray and ask the creator to help us tame our tounge. 

The tounge is something that should be tamed and guided, that is the reason why we need to think before we speak and not vice-versa. 
I hope we learn not to use our tounge against ourselves. 
Thanks for coming around.  I run a relationship show here every Saturday,
root_title: The tounge: A useful and destructive instrument.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Preparing a good vegetable soup.
body:
Vegetable soup is one I really love because it is highly nutritious and tasty(when prepared properly).
I want to share some tips on the way I prepare my own vegetable soup. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/qzdmge4e7r.jpg)

I get my leaf ready by slicing and washing it properly, I set that aside. 
I slice my onion to a moderate size. 
I get my pepper properly grounded and set aside as well. 
I get my seasonings ready which includes Maggi and salt. 
I love to use the local locust bean,  so I set that aside as well. 
Then,  I make sure my meat is properly washed and boiled,  my stock fish de-boned and washed. 
My palm oil is also a very important ingredient. 

### Cooking Procedure. 
I set my neat pot on a low heat and I allow it to dry,  then I carefully add the required amount of palm oil and allow to heat. 
The next thing I do is to add my sliced onions and fry a little bit. 
I add my pepper and seasoning and also fry. 
I carefully add my locust bean, meat and fish as well, I cover it and allow it to steam.
root_title: Preparing a good vegetable soup.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: My Experience in the Village (Episode Three).
body:
I went to bed early last night, that was after the source of light in the village has been put off,  just after few hours of resting,  I heard a loud sound, I was not certain about what it was but it sounded so well like a gunshot. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/f2xnudfvwh.jpg)
The sound was really close that I got scared,  my mind raced towards different directions but this was a rather strange one and I had no idea to what was going on. 
Thank goodness, my room is very close to my colleagues room and I could hear her murmuring, so I called out to her,  and she had no idea about what was going on as well. 

We tried to sleep and stay calm but the gunshots increased and we just stayed calm on the bed in our respective rooms, we were anxiously waiting for day break as this will help us know the next line of action to take, the gunshot increased and even became more obvious. 
Of course, I had my hand bag ready, it contained the necessary things I would need to convey me back home. 

When we woke up this mor
root_title: My Experience in the Village (Episode Three).

author: oluwatobiloba
title: My Experience in the Village (Second Episode)
body:
It was time to resume duty as a classroom teacher and we had to get up on time,  prepare for school and begin the work we have been paid to do. 
I tried to wake up on time,  got ready for school and I headed for the classroom. 
 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/8uwnln8csd.jpg)
After we were introduced as the new teachers that will be around for a year,  the students were really excited to see new faces.  
Realizing how poor their spoken english was, I decided to help out by taking the subject (even if I am also not really good at it). 

While standing, I noticed something bite me on my leg and when I tapped it, it produces blood.
I marvelled at what it might be,  then I was informed that they have insects here that bite and the best thing was to get long socks and clothes that will cover my arms as well, in order to avoid the bite I could get from this tiny insects. 

See you around friends, stay loved and stay blessed.
root_title: My Experience in the Village (Second Episode)

author: oluwatobiloba
title: No one should be underrated.
body:
On so many occasions people loose relevant and important opportunities all because of unnecessary pride.  There are individuals whose lives are filled with pride,  they live,  walk, speak in arrogant ways. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/0jq5hzupxq.jpg)
[Image Credit](https://www.google.com.ng/amp/s/hbpo.co/movies/2018/09/21/10-gen-iv-pokemon-no-one-ought-to-catch-and-10-that-are-underrated.html/amp)

People who have such attitude usually send positivism away from themselves because they sometimes loose the opportunity of getting to meet the right individuals. 

There are people who look as if they have nothing, the reason why they look that way is best known to them, sometimes they even look hopeless and helpless.  The only time you know the type of person that they are is when you move close to them. 

One good way to live is to look at everyone as though they have something to offer,  one simple truth is that,  sometimes they may not even offer you money, but they may have other valuable things to offer
root_title: No one should be underrated.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: There are people who still believe that gadgets are bad ideas.
body:
Have you ever meet with people who still live in the ancient world even in this technology filled days? 
There are people who believe that does who hold on to their phones or laptops for a long time, must be involved in fraudulent acts.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/tb906wx449.jpg)
[Image credit](https://www.google.com.ng/amp/s/amp.usatoday.com/amp/747310002)

I was travelling on a beautiful day through a public transport and I was just trying to operate my phone when I heard a man sitting at the back of the bus saying, all this young people that love to operate their phones,  I wonder what is interesting or fascinating about the phone, I just smiled and ignored him. 

I have also heard a young lady say that people who always operate their phones are jobless and lazy,  I simply ignored as well and then I started to imagine, if there are people who do not understand that there are so many things that could be done with mobile phones. 
I am just sharing my thoughts with you dear friends,  thanks for coming
root_title: There are people who still believe that gadgets are bad ideas.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: A dramatic marriage.
body:
I went to visit a friend who sells food one day and her neighbor's children came to buy food,  the first one bought for the father while the second bought for the mother,  they both demanded for change and while she tried to pair them together, the children shouted "No oo", our father's money is different from our mother's money,  don't join it together oo,  we do not want any trouble this afternoon. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/noqjtsj497.jpg)
[Image credit](http://www.serialgossip.com/gossip-4770-a)

The statement was funny, amazing and annoying at the same time,  I marvelled at this happening and I was told by my friend that the parents do not combine money together. 
I tried to imagine the children asking for school fee and the parents sharing the responsibility amongst themselves, I also tried to imagine them contributing money to prepare food and then they begin to share the meat amongst themselves and other dramatic happenings.
But I have never seen anything like that before so I have decided to
root_title: A dramatic marriage.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Nature Describes Beauty.
body:
![image](https://img.esteem.ws/wa2fjn5mw7.jpg)

The beauty of nature is overwhelming,
The radiancy that comes with nature cannot be compared with another, 
Nature is a description of perfection, 
Everything is circled within the ecosystem,
Light and darkness at it's own pace, 
Everything coming out in seasons, 
Plants bearing it's fruit in seasons, 
Land producing it's crop at the right time, 
The skies describes beauty,
The perfection that comes with the mixing of colours and radiancy all around. 
Nature describes glory,  I hope you love it also. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/kar640iuyy.jpg)

Thanks for reading, I am @tobi. 

[Image Credit 1](https://www.canva.com/learn/bucket-list-50-beautiful-places-earth-photograph/)

[Image Credit 2](https://news.bitcoin.com/bitcoin-tapping-laws-nature-part-2/)
root_title: Nature Describes Beauty.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Pain of a Young Mother .
body:
Of course I knew that the price of goods are quite different from the ones I will get from nearby traders but I decided to get my product from her because in her eyes, I see a young woman who is in pain.

https://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2014/07/16/article-2694117-1FADB2E000000578-263_470x655.jpg
[Credit](https://i.dailymail.co.uk/i/pix/2014/07/16/article-2694117-1FADB2E000000578-263_470x655.jpg)

There is a woman who sells things very close to my apartment, this young woman has three kids .
Through her eyes, I see pain and hatred.
At a young age, I see her struggling to survive and feed her little children.
With sagging breast,and an old wrapper tied around her chest, she runs around town looking for means of survival.


https://www.capitalfm.co.ke/lifestyle/files/2015/03/black_couple_distant1-378x350.jpg
[Credit](https://www.capitalfm.co.ke/lifestyle/files/2015/03/black_couple_distant1-378x350.jpg)

I however see her husband at a corner, chatting with friends, he is not bothered about the education of his k
root_title: The Pain of a Young Mother .

author: oluwatobiloba
title: An Encounter With The Mighty One.
body:
There was a certain woman, who was called barren amongst her friends and mate, 
Families said till eternity, she would never have a child,  some others told her that she was never destined to have a child all through her years on earth. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/5hikvtqzw6.jpg)
[Image Source](https://scroll.in/article/808638/an-encounter-with-the-mighty-bamera-star-of-bandhavgarh)

She looked all around, she cried and screamed for help but she got known,  she ran from one place to another to seek assistance but everything proved fruitile, she could not place her finger on what her offence could be. 

Someone told her one day that if she could see the 'Mighty one', her problem will be solved. 
Now,  the question became how she could get in touch with the mighty one.
 
 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/w4no4luj08.jpg)
[Image Source](http://www.aspiremag.net/art-becoming-unstuck/)

She looked around for the mighty one,  she was scammed, duped among others, but there was absolutely nothing she could do abo
root_title: An Encounter With The Mighty One.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The sad experience of loosing baby Regina.
body:
As if the stress of traveling through a bad road and the thoughts of what rats would have done to my room in my absence was not enough, I returned to the village where I have to stay for a while feeling very weak and tired and just as I walked towards the back of the house,  I noticed a little crowd  gathered around baby Regina's house. 

Regina is a cute baby who happens to be my friend,  we are almost together everytime except when she is in school. 
I moved close and I realized that she had collapsed and efforts were being made to restore her. 
Her father shouted with a shaky voice as he held his daughter, look at your aunty,  he said.  I moved close and I held her hand,  she held my hand in a firm way until she no longer had the strength and she released my hand. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/k6ikty38ac.jpg)
Regina,  Regina we all screamed,  some began to pray but I guess it was late already because Regina was tired of struggling and she gave up. 
People screamed,  tears and wailing came in from diff
root_title: The sad experience of loosing baby Regina.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: A man of virtue deserves to be celebrated.
body:
There are people who deserve honour, 
There are those who deserve praise, 
There are individuals who deserve to be celebrated, 
Some people are gifted,
Some others are unique, 
The reason is not because they were born that way, 
But they decided to train themselves that way, 
I know of people who never allow the hurt from the past affect them. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/xyvrqyd81f.jpg)

Just yesterday, I saw a rare gem being celebrated, 
A man of virtue, 
A man of honour,. A wonderful person with a golden heart,
A man who has been broken over and over again but decided to stay strong and lovely. 

Yesterday was his birthday and I could tell how well he has been able to impact into people's lives even at a very young age,  I was out to celebrate him also because I know how much he means to me. 
I celebrate you once again dear friend.  May you live long on earth.
root_title: A man of virtue deserves to be celebrated.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Look strong on the outside, it makes you more attractive.
body:
I was sitting down outside one day receiving some fresh air,  when someone walked up to me and said, you don't seem to have any worries whatsoever, I always see you smiling and another person quickly answered,  she has no problem whatsoever she is always happy and smiling. 
I smiled the more as I thought about my current condition at that moment, at the moment when those words were spoken, I was financially down,  emotionally broken but the reason why I was smiling is one thing I cannot even explain. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/qra3k9days.jpg)
[Credit](https://www.google.com.ng/amp/www.thejournal.ie/mental-health-smile-1550017-Jul2014/%3Famp%3D1)

That day I realized that it is essential and necessary not to wear a sad face no matter what happens to you. 
I felt proud of myself that day,  that I could be inwardly broken and still look strong. 

On countless occasions, I have had people come to me to explain what they are going through at that point and how they needed encouragement, I will try all I ca
root_title: Look strong on the outside, it makes you more attractive.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The story of a young artist.
body:
Doing something you love to do is a great factor that could get you anywhere in life,  there is nothing that can be as good as being selfish motivated. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/tody0rudfa.jpg)

Today,  I am greatly inspired by the story of my kid brother, he is really strong and determined, he is someone who is indeed hardworking.
I remember when he developed interest in designing and other things, he did not have a good system but he joined wires together and he kept in managing what he had at hand. 

Today my baby brother is grown and he has also become better at the things that he does,  he is stronger,  he is better and even more amazing and without learning from anyone, he now makes designs flawlessly. 
His story has made me believe in the fact that you can achieve anything no matter what happens.
root_title: The story of a young artist.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: To the love of my life,  may everyday be filled with reasons to celebrate.
body:
Today I smiled as I remembered that in some days time I will be celebrating an amazing personality, someone who has loved me deeply despite my errors. 
He is someone I describe as a 'keeper',  because he will not just let go of anything that means something to him,  he is someone with a unique and amazing personality. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/lq5dwts1xs.jpg)
[Credit](https://www.google.com.ng/amp/s/www.pinterest.com/amp/pin/641622278134837718/)

I celebrate you today and always darling,  I wish you God's favor and grace everyday. 
May everyday of your life be filled with reasons to smile,  reasons to celebrate. 

My sweetheart, you are blessed within and without, you are extremely favored and blessed of the most high.  Continue to bask in God's faithfulness because you are lifted. 
Happy birthday in advance darling, I wish you the best in life and even in the after life.
Have it at the back of your mind always,  that I love you so so much and I will always do.
root_title: To the love of my life,  may everyday be filled with reasons to celebrate.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: One of those stories about mermaids, could they be real?
body:
Sometimes I wonder if some of the stories we hear are real? 
If you are Nigerian or African, you will understand that we have a lots of myths told to us by our parents and even relatives alike. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/oaxv0spqty.jpg)
[Credit](http://tajanstvenabica.blogspot.com/2015/07/u-neverovatnoj-galeriji-mitoloskih-bica.html)

We cannot tell sometimes if this stories we hear are true or untrue but I will tell you one of those stories I heard that we cannot tell if it is true or not. 

One of tese stories include that of "Mermaids", that name gives a lot of reaction in people's minds, some hear of it and get very scared while others hear of it and wish to see it. 

It is popularly believed that Mermaids are living creatures who live beneath the waters, they are believed to be very strong and powerful creatures.  When they like or love you,  they bring good fortune, wealth and prosperity but if they do not like you on the other hand,  they could cause misery and misfortune.

A colleague just tol
root_title: One of those stories about mermaids, could they be real?

author: oluwatobiloba
title: All unto one source.
body:
Sometimes I get to listen to different messages or preaching from various places of worship and I hear them argue about the fact that that their own believe is the best and every other person's is only a waste of time. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/7wd3e96l6w.jpg)
[Image credit](http://africanparadiseworld.com/2017/10/14/power-of-faith-in-god/)

There was a day I listened to a message from a woman and she was actually saying that every other individual who is not acting or worshiping according to what she believes is doom and they will all be amazed on the last day since only those who believed in what she believed will see the glory of the most high. 

I smiled as I listened to her speak,  because I have a conviction that we are only allowing religion to act as a barrier between us all. 
I feel we will all get better if we have the mindset that we are all unto a single source. 
No matter what you do,  irrespective of the way you want to do it,  it is all unto one great source (the father of all). 

Reli
root_title: All unto one source.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba.  It's all about relationships.
body:
Hello lovers, I welcome you to this amazing episode of  let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba, I am extremely excited about this episode because we have a guy on the show and it has really been a long time.
With smiles on my face,  I welcome our guest for today to the show and we are going to keep him anonymous, he is going to speak for himself.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/csggmwclwx.jpg)

### From our guest. 
Hello friends, I must say that I am excited to finally get on the show today in order to discuss something that has caused me so much pain. 
I have a girl that I love and admire so much,  I am not someone who cheats,  I love to stick with the person that I love. 
But,  my colleague has been telling me so much about this new girl he found, he said he just wants to have his way with her and forget about her. 
I finally realized that the girl my colleague has been talking about is my girl friend, I asked her repeatedly if she was seeing any other person but she denied on several occasions. 

About
root_title: Let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba.  It's all about relationships.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: How do you handle a rude and disrespectful boss?
body:
I believe everyone on earth deserves a little bit of respect,  this should be irrespective of the persons age or status.  The fact that you are above someone or a set of people does not make you better than them in anyway. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/e2d0nud2x2.jpg)
[Image credit](https://www.td.org/insights/19-traits-of-bad-bosses)

I have a boss,  who is very rude and disrespectful, he obviously has no regard for anything or anyone, he speaks to everyone in the way he feels. 
He believes that he can send people on errands at anytime of the day. 

The way he speaks with people his really annoying, when he sends people on errand,  he will never add please or help, he believes that his staff should always respond to his call at every time he needs them. 

So friends,  what do you think,  have you experienced such before,  or do you think it is normal, let me hear from you. 
Have a great weekend, join me on the show tomorrow,  let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba. 
You can always send your questions a
root_title: How do you handle a rude and disrespectful boss?

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The power of a woman in a relationship.
body:
It is not easy to maintain a relationship, it is never easy to keep your relationship going, I love to learn new things about life generally because no one is an island of knowledge and the day we decide to stop learning, is the moment we begin to die. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/5zkrlj3omi.jpg)
[Image Source](https://www.google.com.ng/amp/s/www.pinterest.com/amp/pin/210121138843569903/)

I learnt something new today and I would love to share it with you, it is all about the power of a woman in a relationship. 
I found out that a woman might not be as strong as a man,  but a good woman is emotionally stronger. 
We  have the power to control our relationships, sometimes our men go through so much emotionally even if they try to act strong,  we have to become their peace and the woman who will push them back on our feet.

Truth be told,  sometimes men do not deserve the "push-ups " that we might want to give,  some of them make us feel very stupid for making necessary sacrifices in the relationship. 
But
root_title: The power of a woman in a relationship.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Let's Talk About Those Who Love To Seek Attention.
body:
The rate at which people try to destroy the image of others to gain favor for themselves is really really alarming. 
People do not care to kill,  destroy or even ruin others,  as long as it turns out to work for their favour, then they are okay with it. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/kb4xzpp8w0.jpg)
[Image credit](https://www.google.com.ng/amp/s/amp.uk.businessinsider.com/how-deal-with-people-you-dont-like-2017-3)
The most surprising one is that there are some set of individuals who always want to receive praise wherever they are found.
In a bid to get this,  they try to destroy the reputation of any other person who is receiving the attention. 

The motivation behind this post is that I noticed a secondary school teacher who wants the school management to like him more than the other teacher, I however became angry when I realized that, he could go as far as saying bad things about another teacher to the school management in order to get their attention. 
Then I began to ask myself for the reason why som
root_title: Let's Talk About Those Who Love To Seek Attention.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: What Name Could One Possibly Give To An Amazing Change of Story?
body:
In amazing ways the story of a man could be changed within seconds ....
Some people call it miracle, and some other people call it different names,  but whatever name you choose to call it, I know that strange and amazing things happen to people. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/crysh7pz82.jpg)
[Image credit](Supernatural Wiki - Fandom)

There was this Lady who almost had nothing to eat some months ago,  she would stay on her bed and cry and take what we call garri here in Nigeria, since that was the cheapest thing she could get. 
She would not even dare to say she wanted to buy a new clothes or make a neat and attractive hair since she had no extra cash on her. 
Pain filled her heart daily but all she could do was to work and hope that things turn out well very soon. 

This pretty lady some weeks back smiled as she told me how things turned for her miraculously, she was able to clear her debt and she lives well and could also give to people. 
I was so happy to hear her story and I hope and pray this day th
root_title: What Name Could One Possibly Give To An Amazing Change of Story?

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Let's talk about those who have money but look wretched
body:
Hi friends, I welcome you to my blog once again and I want to share something that I have noticed with you,  I don't know if you have ever seen anything like that before or if you have any idea about the reason for such. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/gi0wp96t6u.jpg)

I have seen some set of individuals who obviously make a lot of money but they still look very poor, I mean when you look at their clothes, their houses, their cars(if they have one), their meals,  it doesn't depict wealth at all compared with the huge amount of money that they make everyday. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/g7wym1tgwp.jpg)

The reason behind this is one thing I cannot explain, some say it is because their money might be obtained in a wrong way,  others say it might be that they only want to invest. 

Personally, I don't think living an extravagant life is cool,  but atleast, you should look presentable and classy in your own way.
  Why will someone work so much for money and decide not to eat well or look good? 

So,  what
root_title: Let's talk about those who have money but look wretched

author: oluwatobiloba
title: I Welcome You to the 29th Episode of Let's Talk About it with @oluwatobiloba.
body:
Hi friends, welcome to another great episode of let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba. I hope you are having a great weekend? 
Let me start today's show by asking you this simple question :
For how long can you hold on for someone who does not seem to care about what is happening to you? 
I mean if you have someone you love and you are really crazy about, how long can you hold on for the person?
 
 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/7u3v5vyuyh.jpg)
Now,  let's get to the gist of the day......... 
I got talking with a friend today and tears almost rolled down her pretty and adorable small looking face as she told me about the guy she was in love with. 
She told me about how much she cared about him,  how she will constantly call to check up on him,  and she will also get really worried whenever she is not able to get in touch with him. 
The most confusing thing about her story however, was that the young man will not call her unless he has something to ask or something urgent to say. 
He does not call to check
root_title: I Welcome You to the 29th Episode of Let's Talk About it with @oluwatobiloba.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Celebrating My Father.
body:
This is for my Dad. 
My last post was for my Mum and I do not want to sound biased by leaving my father behind. 
The father figure is one that is relevant and important in the society, a lot of things will be left undone and a lot of things will remain unaccomplished if there is no figure of a father in the house. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/3o9o9uc14n.jpg)

My father is a lovely person with an amazing personality, he is firm, disciplined and lovely.  He jokes with us when he feels it is necessary, but asides such days and periods,  we are expected to remain serious. 
My father will never tolerate any act of indiscipline from any of us,  he created so much fear into our hearts that even if he is not around, we will be very scared of doing any wrong thing. 
This act of discipline helped me a lot to stay away from bad friends. 

Dad,  you are good, amazing, I wish you long years and peace of mind in good health and long days.
root_title: Celebrating My Father.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: A Simple Word of Appreciation Goes A Long Way.
body:
How often do you appreciate the people around you?
Appreciating the people around you means that you know their worth, value and what they can offer. 
One thing we do not know is that,  sometimes appreciation is the only thing people need,  once they see someone who could just say thank you and show them off, they feel satisfied. 
 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/tisv6ndyug.jpg)

Some individuals feel they have to give money to show how much they appreciate people's effort,  but the truth is that, sometimes, it goes beyond just what you can give,  and then it has to with how much you can praise them and tell people around that they are of great value and benefit to you.

Thanks for coming around, I remain your very own @tobi.
root_title: A Simple Word of Appreciation Goes A Long Way.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Get Addicted To Positivism.
body:
Hello friends, it is another bright and wonderful day and today I want to talk to u about the things we fill our minds with. 
Consciously or unconsciously,  the things we hear,see, feel and touch gets our mind occupied and those things begin to get stored up in our minds gradually. 
It however takes a voluntary action to know what to ruminate on as humans or what to delete .

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/8174e5anx8.jpg)
How often do you take your minds off negativism? 
Negativism is a serious factor that could ruin or permanently destroy and destabilize an individual.
We see negative things and situations all around, but it depends on us to either accept it as a life style or determine to always stay positive. 

In all that you do dear friend, always remember that positivism is the way to prosperity,  take your mind away from negative thoughts, even if everything around you describes negativity,  always bear in mind that positivism is the key to greatness.
root_title: Get Addicted To Positivism.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: A Place to call Home - Family.
body:
Hello dearies, welcome to another great day, it is also an amazing weekend as this gives us the opportunity to spend time with our loved ones.
The truth remains that we really need to work in order to get basic necessities of life, it is required that we work to stay off hunger and poverty.

http://happyfamilycs.com/beadyranga/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/Black-Family.jpg
[Image Credit](http://happyfamilycs.com/beadyranga/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/Black-Family.jpg)

However, spending time with the people we cherish will go a long way in saving us lots of trouble and pain in the nearest future.
No matter how well we work, we need a place to retire to at our old age,and the best place to retire is home.
Home is a place we should always want to run to  whenever we have no place to go to.

When I speak of home, I am not referring to the walls or buildings, rather, I speak of the humans there, those you have made to to trust you over the years, those you have made to believe in your dreams and in everything you do
root_title: A Place to call Home - Family.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Why On Earth Would  A Successful Woman  Decide to Remain  in a Dangerous  Relationship.
body:
Things will never seize to happen in this world we live in and strange things really do happen everyday. 
Yes,  I missed the relationship show on Saturday and that is because we had no guest for the show and I apologize about that. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/580wf1bjng.jpg)I welcome you to another episode of let's talk about it with @tobi. 
I was in a place this weekend and I overheard some women having a serious discussion which really got me worried. 
I saw this woman from a distance and I admired her spirit of hard work and the fact that she was pretty also attracted me to her, I was however shocked when she started complaining about the fact her husband was a terrible person. 

I had seen scars on her body earlier but I thought she had sustained an injury, only for me to realize that she constantly receives beating from her husband whom she regularly receives beating from.
Her husband beats her,  inflicts injuries on her and regularly makes her look stupid in public. 

This woman I am talking abou
root_title: Why On Earth Would  A Successful Woman  Decide to Remain  in a Dangerous  Relationship.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The right and wonderful attitude to situations makes you a better person.
body:
What if we all learn to behave in a good and accrptable way,  what do you think will happen to the world we live in right now. 
There are situations and things that are usually very  annoying and unbearable. 
 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/qx608ezd50.jpg)
I was travelling in a public transport, the bus was stopped by the members of road union association and the bus driver was accused of picking up more than one passenger (Which is false)
The driver tried to plead with them as well as the passengers,  but they refused to listen, before we could say JACK, every of the bus tyre was destroyed. 

The passengers however got angry and began to shout at those who destroyed an innocent man's vehicle.  One of them then decid d to fight by beating an elderly man who told him that he had done the wrong thing. 

This man who was a member of the road union slapped one of the passengers,  he was however surprised when the Nigerian force gathers around him. I am sure he would not forget the experience he had with the memb
root_title: The right and wonderful attitude to situations makes you a better person.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: My Experience Today As A Village Classroom Teacher.
body:
Hello friends, I hope we are all having a great week,  as usual I have another story/gist for you today oo and I hope that you enjoy it, even if it is not an exciting one. 
You remember I told you about relocating to this new rural area where I have to stay for a year and something really dramatic happened today that I want to share with you. 
  ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/zm5i28j7nk.jpg)
In this rural area,  I have to work as a secondary school teacher and the school building does not have windows or doors. 
Just as we were about to begin classes for the day, a strong wind began to blow and it was followed by a very heavy rain. 
Some of the students whose classrooms were extremely bad had to run to manage with other students whose classrooms were still better.
![image](https://img.esteem.ws/xcasln7fxf.jpg)
I had to run to the little covered staff room provided, since the rain and the cold weather will leave no chance for teaching.
 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/uq03c4xzvg.jpg)
 ![image](https://img.este
root_title: My Experience Today As A Village Classroom Teacher.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Welcome To This Week's Episode of Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba.
body:
Hi Lovers, I welcome you to another beautiful episode of let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba.  It has really been a while and I must say that I have missed you so much, I apologize for missing the show last week and I am glad to have everyone of you around this week,  so grab a chair,  sit and enjoy this week's story that will keep you glued to your seat. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/7u3v5vyuyh.jpg)

### Relationship Questions For The Week.
While choosing a partner (I mean lover) , what is the first thing you will consider in the person? 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/csggmwclwx.jpg)
### Relationship Gist For The Week. 
I actually caught him in bed banging my best friend, I was gone for just two weeks and I tried my best to communicate with him constantly. 
I told him I will be back three days later because I wanted to surprise him with my presence, only for me to open the door to our bedroom and I found him on bed with my best friend. 

The shock was so much for me to bear that I passed out,  I
root_title: Welcome To This Week's Episode of Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Put Away Negative Energy.
body:
Hello amazing readers, I am so happy to have you around and today I want to talk to you about having a positive vibe. 
 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/vge6nsv1ed.jpg)

Having a positive vibe means having a positive energy towards all that you do. While we have those who spend their time and energy on things that are of no value,  it is important that we learn to convert our energy into things that are productive. 

Rather than putting your zeal into things that are unproductive and not really important,  why not try out something good and beneficial.
There are individuals who are bent on spending their time and energy on ruining others and making them worthless.
My question is what are the things you spend your energy on,  are they things that are productive or not? 
Spend your time today on something good and productive. 
Have a great day. 

I run a relationship show here every Saturday, you can send in your shout-outs, bottled messages and relationship questions here: adekunlemercy95@gmail.com
root_title: Put Away Negative Energy.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: When Exactly Did the Hatred Begin?
body:
There is a couple that lives right behind my window and they have three lovely kids. The way this two behaves makes me ask myself if they never studied each other before they settled down and started having babies.


https://s4.scoopwhoop.com/anj/Photo/c9149c3a-8bcb-4f05-af17-6346d4cdc8e8.jpg
[Reference](https://www.scoopwhoop.com/every-failed-relationship-teaches-us-something/)

They treat each other with a high level of disrespect and hatred. Just this morning I overheard the wife telling her husband that, even if he wants to act in stupid ways, he should not do it in the presence of the kids.

Some days back, the husband locked the door to their room leaving the woman outside with wrapper and he went out with the keys.
Neighbours came to plead on her behalf but it fell on deaf ears.

The fight as well as the look of hatred on their faces makes the relationship an unpleasant one.
It is as bad as if the husband finds his wife beating any of their kids, he will beat her back.
I feel pity for them, but the qu
root_title: When Exactly Did the Hatred Begin?

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Stop Feeling Bad About The Thorns, Work Hard To Remove The Thorns.
body:
One thing that affects us as humans is that we worry and disturb ourselves so much about things we should only ignore. 
It is important to learn to ignore things that are not really relevant. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/owq5uurpqm.jpg)

There are situations in life that take away every of our of our peace,  pride and happiness and we should never allow such things happen to us. 
No doubt about the fact that life will not always be a bed of roses, but one thing I know is that we can decide to look for a way to get rid of the thorns whenever they show up.
Rather than sitting and getting worried over the things that we cannot control, it is necessary that we wake up to the fact that we can try to get rid of them.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/mc4gfvl23u.jpg)
One thing that is as well of a basic importance is that the thorns will never go away if there is no deliberate effort from us to take them away. 

### Become determined to succeed and make progress, with love from @oluwatobiloba.
root_title: Stop Feeling Bad About The Thorns, Work Hard To Remove The Thorns.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Praises to the Giver of Good Gifts.
body:
This is specially written to the lifter of my head,
To the one who gives every good gifts,
The one who makes everything beautiful in their own season,
The giver of all talents,
My rock and source of defence,
The one who believed in me even when friends and family were against me,
My help and the lifter up of my head.

https://imagesvc.meredithcorp.io/v3/mm/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcdn-image.realsimple.com%2Fsites%2Fdefault%2Ffiles%2Fstyles%2Fmedium_2x%2Fpublic%2F102416376_0.jpg%3Fitok%3DRmPKOOLA&w=400&c=sc&poi=face&q=85
[Image Source](
https://www.realsimple.com/work-life/work-life-etiquette/gift-receiving-manners)

I love to call him my father and my friend,
He is the God of all flesh,
He is the giver of every good gift,
The sustainer of live and the giver of peace.
My source and my strength.
Look up to him today for strength dearies.
root_title: Praises to the Giver of Good Gifts.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Making Impact Wherever You Find Yourself.
body:
Hello dear friends, today I want to talk to you about making necessary impact in the areas where you are found. 
We should learn as humans that it is necessary for us to leave a foot print wherever we are. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/1utic754l6.jpg)

There are times I find my self in places I am not really happy about or contended with,  during such periods I simply fold my hands and stay back,  because of the anger I feel within. 
But,  as time goes on, I began to realize that weather or not I am happy with the place I am, I have to leave a good foot mark behind. 

One basic truth is that,  sooner or later,  we might have to relocate and move further, but the most important thing is what people have to say in your absence. 

Thanks for reading, I remain your very own @oluwatobiloba.
root_title: Making Impact Wherever You Find Yourself.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Hey Lovers,  Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba.
body:
Wow.... It is another beautiful Saturday again  and I am so happy to inform you that we have the 27th episode of let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba. 
I am grateful to the giver of ideas and to my amazing and ever supportive friends and viewers. May God bless you all,  thank you so much. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/wix26iedu7.jpg)

Today's episode is going to be an interesting one as usual and what can I say than thank you to those who have sent in questions.
Handling relationship stories have made me realize that this thing called love and relationship is so wide..... 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/csggmwclwx.jpg)

### Heading Straight To The Relationship Gist For This Week. 

This week we have two beautiful guests who have simple questions to ask us and I am sure that adequate answers will be provided by my ever reliable viewers......

Guest1: A pleasure for me to meet people like you, who care about relationships and everything that has to do with this. My name is Daniel I've been married for
root_title: Hey Lovers,  Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Live Well but don't get Wasteful.
body:
I have learnt that it is wrong to wait until you have everything you want before you get something good for yourself.
Sometimes, we make plans and we say to ourselves that we are not going to eat well until we are able to make a certain amount of money in return monthly, some people decide not to dress well until they are able to make a certain amount of money as well.

https://dg.imgix.net/i-ve-already-wasted-my-life-now-what-ku6ptstb-en/landscape/i-ve-already-wasted-my-life-now-what-ku6ptstb.jpg?ts=1461776679&ixlib=rails-3.0.2&auto=format%2Ccompress&fit=min&w=700&h=394&dpr=2&ch=Width%2CDPR
[Credit](https://www.desiringgod.org/interviews/ive-already-wasted-my-life-now-what)

But the truth is that, we can never be fully satisfied, we have to learn to take care of ourselves.
Taking good care of yourself includes eating well and dressing well, but this does not mean that you have to be wasteful or live beyond your boundary, you do not have to borrow to live a good life.
Live within your boundary and live a goo
root_title: Live Well but don't get Wasteful.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: A Meeting With The Village Elders.
body:
Hello dear readers,  I welcome you greatly to my blog and I am so excited to have you around.
I had to relocate to this new place where I am supposed to stay for a year,  this new location is a rural area and I have seen a lot of weird things.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/84f97iw7nn.jpg)

This morning,  I heard the town crier announcing and telling every villager to come out for a meeting by 04:00pm.
Everyone came out at the time and the village elders held a meeting with the villagers. 

When everyone else left the meeting, some individuals stayed behind to settle dispute and the elders of the village served as the judge.
root_title: A Meeting With The Village Elders.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Testimonies Help to Build Faith.
body:
Happy Sunday to every beautiful soul around, it is a good period to spend time with family and to relax as well.
For Christians, we approach the beautiful time of Easter, a period where we recount how our saviour sacrificed for us to enjoy a beautiful and sin-free life.

https://www.christian-faith.com/wp-content/uploads/2007/01/Christian-testimonies-of-freedom-1.jpg
[Image Credit](
https://www.christian-faith.com/true-stories-testimonies-of-jesus-christ/)

It is important to know that sharing of testimonies help to lift the burden of others, and it also helps to keep the body of Christ in faith.
Today, I attended a student church, where ex-students who have been members of the church were asked to come and testify about how God saw them through the school without issues.
This testimony encouraged students who were present in the church, and this act surely built up their faith.
So, as believers, it is important to tell of the goodness of the Lord to help others trust and have faith in his existence the more
root_title: Testimonies Help to Build Faith.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Religion and the Fear to Look Beautiful.
body:
As a child, my family believed it was a crime to look fashionable as a result of our religious background.
Our religion forbids us to look attractive and then we had to grow up condemning those people who looked adorable or who choose to spend time on their looks.
You won't blame me though, I grew up with this trend so I didn't have a choice but to follow the trend.

https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8a/Scared_Child_at_Nighttime.jpg/220px-Scared_Child_at_Nighttime.jpg
[Image Source](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fear)

I increased in age and size and then it dawned on me the more that I was different.
I wanted to look like those my family condemned, I wanted my beauty to show.
Finally, I took up the courage to begin to dress well and look like those that my family members hated.
It was not an easy one I must confess, it took me years of pain and struggle to finally get the liberty to dress in a beautiful way.
I was tagged the bad egg of the family, the naughty child and the one who wou
root_title: Religion and the Fear to Look Beautiful.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Could This Be Loneliness?
body:
There is a space in my heart, 
I feel a vacant space in my heart right now, 
I feel something could fill it up right now, 
The pains and ache I feel in my heart, 
Is one that is getting unbearable. 

![image](https://img.esteem.ws/e3w3q6oce5.jpg)

Could this be the feeling of loneliness,
Could this be what people experience in their lonely state, 
I feel really empty and I don't even know what to call it. 

Can you help me with a word to describe my state of mind? 
Could it be loneliness or something else? 

Thanks for reading.  Anticipate the relationship show on Saturday remember you can always send in your relationship issues,  questions and stories. 
You can also send Shout-outs and bottled messages through, Mail: adekunlemercy95@gmail.com.
See you around, stay awesome and loved.
root_title: Could This Be Loneliness?

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Let's About It With @oluwatobiloba.  It's All About Love,  Relationship and Life.
body:
Good morning wonderful viewers, it is with great pleasure that I welcome you to another sweet episode of let’s talk about it with @oluwatobiloba.

I must confess that it is a great honour to have you all on the show today and I say a big thank you to you for coming around.

For this week’s edition, we will have a general question asked by a friend of the programme and as well the relationship issue for this week. Sit back and enjoy friends…….

### RELATIONSHIP ISSUE FOR THE WEEK.
Hello Tobi, I am asking this question for a friend, he got romantically involved with a pretty damsel……They like each other and got along easily. Though this guy just decided to give love a chance but it seems i

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Welcome to the 25th episode of let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba.  It's all about matters of the heart.
body:
Hello lovers,  it is an extremely sunny weather over here and stepping out of the house is very scary,  but thank goodness for the sun oo,  atleast our clothes will get dried in time. 
I sincerely apologize once again for missing the show last week, but we are back and better this week.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/csggmwclwx.jpg)

## Relationship Issue For Today.

Hello Tobi,  I am selmat and I heard about your relationship weekly show from a very good friend, I am confused right now and I trust your judgement and your viewers judgement over this issue.  I hope I get help,  the same way my friend got help through your show. 

I started dating this guy about three years ago and although before I meet him he has been with a lot of ladies in the past and he promised he was now a different perso

body:
Hello friends, I am happy that I have you as friends and well-wishers,  may God bless your good heart. 
I am so sorry for my inability to post anything about let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba on Saturday, it was for reasons beyond my control but it is all for good. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/5wy02cvnvg.jpg)

I want you to remember that you are specially loved,  you are amazing and you are irreplaceable. 
I will see you on Saturday for another mind-blowing episode of let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba,  remember it is about love,  life and relationships..

Mail: adekunlemercy95@gmail.com

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba. It Is All About Love,  Life and Relationships.
body:
It is a beautiful Saturday again and it is even a new month.  I am very excited because it is the first day in a new month and every of my friend is viberant and strong.
It is with great pleasure that I welcome you to the month of September and I pray that heavens will favor us this month.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/wix26iedu7.jpg)

I am so sorry today's episode is coming late,  I think this weather is really weighing a lot of people down but I just hope we stay strong. 
Today's episode is going to be a very different one and I want it to be as interactive as possible, so I will be throwing out two questions asked by our guests on the show today. 

I was told to ask these questions and I hope to get lovely viewers participate properly in today's episode. 
The first question is: When two love birds are in a relationship, and one person decides to end the relationship, who do you think feels the pain most, would you say it is the one who insinuated the break up or the one who received the bad news.  (In
root_title: Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba. It Is All About Love,  Life and Relationships.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Sometimes The Best Thing You Can Do Is To Run As Fast As Your Legs Can Carry You. (A Story You Have To Read).
body:
Oh my goodness, what have I done to deserve this for goodness sake, is it a crime to love this young man, Amara screamed from afar as she noticed that the father of her two lovely children has poured the pot of food she was preparing into the waste bin.

https://guardian.ng/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/15601291-domestic-violence-man-hurting-to-a-woman-1-1.jpg
[Image Reference](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=imgres&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwiygbTa1IDdAhVHzqQKHWUSCVMQjRx6BAgBEAU&url=https%3A%2F%2Fguardian.ng%2Ffeatures%2Fthe-health-implications-of-an-abusive-relationship%2F&psig=AOvVaw1DMYeijOi3Vm7IrqMlIegr&ust=1535027362911534)

She had asked him for money to get something prepared for the children that morning, and he had replied to her question with a good slap, they had caused too much drama in the neighbourhood already so she decided to keep mute and almost immediately, she remembered she had 200 Naira note in her bag, her friend had given her the money the previous day.

So, she
root_title: Sometimes The Best Thing You Can Do Is To Run As Fast As Your Legs Can Carry You. (A Story You Have To Read).

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Narrating My Extremely Cold Experience Today.
body:
The cold weather kept me indoor all through the day thank Goodness for the holidays. 
I was just about to carry out some house chores when the rain started and this made my lazy self get back to bed and wrap myself up with a very big blanket. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/vxt9og9ba9.jpg)

Even while I was hungry, I could not prepare anything to eat,  when the rain subsided later in the evening, I went out to buy fried egg and bread from a man that sells around the corner, it is not a place I really like to go but I just had to go there so I I can get something to eat. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/3votddo4h2.jpg)

Here is a picture of when the man was frying the egg for the bread. 
Thanks a lot for coming around, I remain your very own Nigerian Lady @oluwatobiloba.
root_title: Narrating My Extremely Cold Experience Today.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Road To Success Is Not A Straight One.
body:
I have learnt that the road to success is not a smooth one, it has so many hurdles and paths that are not straight.
As a child, I use to think I will just grow up, have the type of life I want, have a family that is very peaceful and loving and everything will just continue to go on well for me.

But, as a young lady now, I wish I could take back the hands of the clock and erase some of the mistakes I have made while growing up. I have learnt that definite decisions should be made at all times in order to accomplish life goals.
Rather than sitting and crying about some occurrence, I do not like, I just know that the road to success is not an easy one.

For anyone who wants to succeed, we have to always bear in mind that the road to success is not an easy one and we have to strife to accomplish success in everything we do.

I love these pictures because they seem to explain more about what I have written.

https://c1.staticflickr.com/6/5702/21266013646_b870802b95_b.jpg
[Image Source](https://www.google.com/ur
root_title: The Road To Success Is Not A Straight One.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Twenty-Second Episode of Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba.  It Is All About Life,  Love and Relationships.
body:
Hello friends, I welcome you to another amazing episode of let’s talk about it with @oluwatobiloba. This week wasn’t too great for Nigerian steemians and that is because we lost one of us, everyone was filled with pain as a result of the loss of this promising young man, but we pray that his gentle soul rest in peace and God will comfort his family and loved ones.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/csggmwclwx.jpg)

The news about the demise of this young man made  Nigerian steemians very sad, people wrote good and lovely things about him that even without knowing him while he was alive, I felt he must have been a very good person.
One question I always ask myself is that, why is it that humans show love and say lovely things to a person after he or she is gone, but while the person is alive they will hurt the person, wish that he never has more than them and other things that are not good enough? 
Although, I understand that this world is filled with wickedness, we can only pray that God protects us and makes
root_title: The Twenty-Second Episode of Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba.  It Is All About Life,  Love and Relationships.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Verbal Abuse....  Watch The Things You Say.
body:
A lot of people loose themselves constantly because of the issue with friends, parents, partners who make use of their vocal cord to say whatever they feel without thinking twice.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/1utic754l6.jpg)

The things we say to others go a long way to either build them or destroy  them,  as humans we should be careful about the things we say as we do not know how much it hurt another person.
root_title: Verbal Abuse....  Watch The Things You Say.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Be contented with what you have and work hard.
body:
There is nothing as good as being content with what you have,  when you are hardworking and contented,  you have peace,  joy and satisfaction.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/9pzsnmfx9q.jpg)

Contentment brings peace and respect.  When a man always want more and more,  greed sets in and as such, they begin to get disrespected by others. 

No matter how little you get,  work hard to get it multiplied,  build yourself and make that little become  multiplied because the moment you begin to allow people talk to you in the manner they please because u were not contented with the little you have. 

Become contented, work hard and live well. 

Thanks for reading, I remain your very own Nigerian Lady @oluwatobiloba. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/y92timyerw.jpg)
Thanks to @gbenga for getting this badge for every Nigerian on Steemit. 

I run a relationship show here every Saturday, join me this Saturday as we explore relationship issues.
root_title: Be contented with what you have and work hard.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Meet My Mancrush For This Monday.
body:
Today is Monday and I want to participate in the #mancrushmonday for the very first time.
My crush is an amazing fellow with a beautiful heart.
His manner of writing is in a skilled way that will make any lady trip and I know that his woman must be a lucky person to have him.

![IMG-20180813-WA0012.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.com/DQmPc28c1V6AJjzK9b6J4G7jtAv9ehqdGWtEw8QX5zcXVLy/IMG-20180813-WA0012.jpg)

## Open letter to my crush.
@fadiji09, Keep being real and keep being strong, constantly hold firm to the things you believe in. Everything might not be perfect just yet, but with time everything will go on well you just have to stay strong and remain excellent.

Life may seem unfair to us but we should know that we need to be strong at all times because our situation is even much better than others, stay happy and stay confident.
I wish you the best.

Thank you for visiting my
root_title: Meet My Mancrush For This Monday.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: There Is Power In The Words We Speak, Stop Being Negative.
body:
I watched and I saw the way mother called their children stupid names, I thought it was probably out of frustration, anger depression or whatever reason they may want to give and then gradually those bad names get struck to the children's head, they begin to act in the way and manner they have been called by their parents.
When a mother calls her child stupid, it is a normal thing to see that the child begins to act in a stupid way.

https://christianitymalaysia.com/wp/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/Woman-hand-over-mouth.jpg
[Image Source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwixjdvY9efcAhWkzIUKHQzCDKoQjRx6BAgBEAU&url=https%3A%2F%2Fchristianitymalaysia.com%2Fwp%2Fthe-word-this-week-the-words-we-speak-releases-a-lethal-power%2F&psig=AOvVaw1FAaET3utU7d3z2mvuRJEM&ust=1534177199059364)

As a young lady, I have learnt that the power in the things we say especially to our loved ones and most especially to those we are closely knitted to, are things we should watch
root_title: There Is Power In The Words We Speak, Stop Being Negative.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Twenty-First Episode of Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba. It Is All About Life, Love and Relationships.
body:
Hello friends, it is another beautiful Saturday again and just like yesterday, we have gone past another week successfully. Even if you had a rough week, I want you to understand that you have every reason to be grateful, your week cannot be as bad as those who lost everything they ever worked for in a single day and it cannot be as bad as those who have lost someone really special to them, so why don't we just take a moment to say thank you to the one who has been our sustainer, and believe that everything will get better with time.

This is my own little way of welcoming you to another exciting episode of let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba, a place where you get the latest gist and you have the opportunity to bring back love to the lives of those who feel helpless and hopeless. The most important thing in life is making an impact while we still have the opportunity to do, so join me as we help restore the smile to someone's face again this week.

![IMG-20180413-WA0002.jpg](https://cdn.steemitimages.co
root_title: The Twenty-First Episode of Let's Talk About It With @oluwatobiloba. It Is All About Life, Love and Relationships.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Thursdays are for Throwbacks. I Have A Lovely Kid Brother.
body:
There are days when I just wake up feeling very excited. Those times are when I have had a good time to talk to my maker and then I feel assured that there is hope for the future, during those times I just sing and appreciate God for all he has given to me. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/hd7s8vi6rm.jpg)
Having siblings who always want to see me smile is one thing that constantly makes me glad. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/e7kture447.jpg)

I woke up very late on this day and my kid brother was waiting for me to give him money to take to school,  so he had to drag me out of bed and we laughed and played before he went to school that day. 

I love my brother and I am glad to have a family I can call my own. 
I remain your very own Nigerian Lady @oluwatobiloba. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/y92timyerw.jpg)
Thanks to @gbenga for getting this badge for every Nigerian on Steemit.
root_title: Thursdays are for Throwbacks. I Have A Lovely Kid Brother.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: I Have Not Been Able To Think Of What To Write For Some Days Now.
body:
Consistently for days, I have not been able to write, and it seems my head and my hands will not just allow me to put something down. While I carried out the day's activities yesterday, I had what to write down on my blog when I get home, but the moment I wanted to start writing down, I was not just able to write anything anymore, it seems as if my head became blank and I could not write anything anymore.

https://psmag.com/.image/t_share/MTI3NTgyNDM4MzkzMTgwMTMw/writers-block.jpg
[Image Source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=imgres&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=2ahUKEwjXzsbOxt3cAhUJKMAKHf4LD6kQjRx6BAgBEAU&url=https%3A%2F%2Fpsmag.com%2Fsocial-justice%2Fblock-quotes-advice-great-writers-kicking-writers-block-85314&psig=AOvVaw3m4cbcvjYzu6kzKg8ZATAd&ust=1533820992958088)

I decided I was going to write something down today no matter what happens, so I am just trying to click my keypad and I hope that what I am writing makes sense.

I will like to tell you to always take out time to relax, relax
root_title: I Have Not Been Able To Think Of What To Write For Some Days Now.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Add Value to your Existence.
body:
There are people who obviously live but have no reason to live,  they live and ask for death to come their way everyday. 
Some of these people have reasons to think this way and the reason is because what life throws at them seem to be really unfair situations.

But,  I have realized that even at periods when we feel like giving up,  we can always look for something to keep our faith strong. 
I have also discovered that one way of keeping your faith strong is by adding value to your existence. 

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/mc4gfvl23u.jpg)

Personally, I feel the best way of adding value to your existence is by doing something for humanity .
Doing something productive for humanity adds value to your existence and also makes you beautiful.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/y92timyerw.jpg)
Thanks to @gbenga for getting this badge for every Nigerian on Steemit.
root_title: Add Value to your Existence.

Hello beautiful readers, I welcome you to another mind-blowing episode of let's talk about it with @oluwatobiloba. I am excited because it was just like yesterday when I took the bold step to begin this show and we have the twentieth episode already, oh how time flies.
I want to say thank you to everyone who has shown me love in one way or the other, I really do appreciate.

## RELATIONSHIP QUESTION FOR THE WEEK.

There is a thing they say about ''first love'' and I want to hear people's opinion about it.
I have heard a lot of people say that no matter how many relationship
