# Hare are some reasons why t
root_title: The Importance of Gratitude

author: oluwatobiloba
title: It is indeed a Man's World
body:
I was sitting in my room this afternoon when my neighbor walked in angrily, I questioned her about what could be the reason for the sad face and she said she was reading a post on face book and a guy was insulting ladies who do not know how to cook as he said that every lady who does not know how to cook is useless. He went further by saying, if as a guy he can cook then he sees no reason why any lady should not know how to cook.

Another guy agreed to what he said and continued by saying do you expect a man to go out to bring money and still not meet a good meal.

I am not saying it is proper for a lady not to know how to cook, but why is it one sided, why is it that every guy who doesn't know how to cook too be regarded as been useless?.

I have argued constantly with my friends that this world we live in,is a Man's world especially in Nigeria where the wife is expected to act as the maid in the home.

https://mrsceonaija.files.wordpress.com/2016/04/do-it-all.gif
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rc
root_title: It is indeed a Man's World

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Love or Madness, I don't know how to describe it.
body:
It is a pleasant morning at this side of the globe, so I am saying a beautiful morning to everyone reading this post, it is pouring down heavily this morning so some people like me have to stay indoor until the rain stops.

I am writing this post because I need to get advise from my very intelligent friends on this plat form about what to do about this situation at hand.

I have said in one of my previous posts that I am a final year biochemistry student. I have this room mate who has been a major source of concern to me.

https://i2.wp.com/430Box.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/08/love-kiss.jpg
[Source](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcRYKlSxzjtAcahPkOj9RofuelLidr0my2eerVDPYAIaeSUJaypQjA)

She is indeed a pretty Lady and smart too (I thought), until I realized that she had not been paying her school fee for a year now, and she collects double of the normal fee from home.

I discovered as well that her mum is a single mother who runs a frozen food store to take care of her kids. 
She is a ve
root_title: Love or Madness, I don't know how to describe it.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Risk Taker
body:
I have realized that people who rule the world are those who have decided to take risk in one way or the other.
This people have built their world around themselves, they have created their own empire.

https://us.123rf.com/450wm/blueringmedia/blueringmedia1311/blueringmedia131100269/23978621-illustration-of-a-busy-businesswoman-on-a-white-background.jpg?ver=6

They are the ones who dare to act on the dread, they do things that a normal person will not want to do.

They have sleepless nights thinking of what to create or how to harness new ideas.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: A Beautiful Morning To Steemians
body:
https://rlv.zcache.com/nigeria_flag_map_2_0_card-r08439997d6c745b0a12b24ed04cc8ee9_xvuak_8byvr_324.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=imgres&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiF8aGn2ezVAhUH6xQKHfw4AA4QjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.zazzle.com%2Figbo%2Bgreeting%2Bcards&psig=AFQjCNH3mykAGiJfEFitT7j-LcgsV3jyMA&ust=1503555084149800)

It is a beautiful morning at this side of the world and what Nigerians love to do is to greet and greet properly.
Nigerians have the habit of greeting until you get frustrated.
We have different slang's of greeting for every occasion.

There are majorly three ethnic groups in Nigeria and they include;

# The Yoruba's

The Yoruba's are believed to be the most cultured ethnic group in Nigeria.
They Yoruba females usually go down on their knees to greet, while the male  prostrate. While greeting an elder in the Yoruba kingdom, they look out for body language and expression and if they are not satisfied with the way you have greeted, they will ask you to do it

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Making Decisions
body:
Decisions are conclusions made after deliberation on certain issues.

As blunt as this may sound, we all have the power to decide what we want for ourselves.

The decisions we make have the power to lead us to greatness or to destroy us.

https://simlachandigarhdiocese.files.wordpress.com/2014/06/simla-chandigarh-diocese_how-to-make-right-decision-02.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=imgres&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjTj73XpOnVAhUFWxQKHS5LA4AQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fsimlachandigarhdiocese.wordpress.com%2F2014%2F06%2F03%2Fhow-to-make-right-decisions%2F&psig=AFQjCNFwuqT5HBrGUxNdi_6vZF7PjbMj-A&ust=1503437878211890)

With  the level that we have attained now, we can say that some things that are  happening to us presently occur as a result of  the decisions we have made in the past.

We have as well been given the opportunity by nature to either make the right choices or the wrong ones, thus we ourselves becoming determinants of what so ever happens to us.

It takes a high l
root_title: Making Decisions

author: oluwatobiloba
title: What Goes Around, Comes Around
body:
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/Jne_6Q-KKb0/maxresdefault.jpg
[image source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=imgres&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjyxOjnueXVAhUDvhQKHT10DOkQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DJne_6Q-KKb0&psig=AFQjCNFzPGpSd96mFN5-C-P_Z4Bz_zdukg&ust=1503306110670825)

I am sure that we all have heard at a point in our lives that the world is in circles and what we give into life is what we will have back in return, but we might not have really taken it into proper consideration.

It is time for humans to wake up and realize that we have the power to determine how we want our future to be by the way we act and treat others now, when people come to that actualization, the world will then become more bearable and a safer place to live in.

http://www.aspiringquotes.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Always-remember-What-goes-around-comes-around.jpg
[image source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&ved=0ahUKEwjpivGDuuXVAhUEWBQKHfm3DYMQjRwI

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Plight of a Childless Woman(Concluding part)
body:
https://static.pulse.ng/img/incoming/crop3746634/9724677365-chorizontal-w1200-h630/Crying-Woman.jpg
[Credit](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQIQAf4nyqYJpMI25oTpLdGPtOhGVecvP9WsZAuPVjqAo0yypHYEQ)

And so the whole house was set into confusion as each person did not know what to say, the whole house was as quite as a grave yard.

Monica's mother in-law quickly stood up and said , so we have the whole case apparently settled now and that means she needs to leave this house this moment , it is that simple.

Sarah's mother quickly jumped to her feet to and added, at least he slept with her and he cannot deny that fact so we never can tell if the pregnancy belongs to him or not until the child is born and he has the sole responsibility to take proper care of her until she gives birth to this child.

Monica stood up quietly and walked straight into her bedroom without saying a word to anyone, everyone was puzzled ,so her friend quickly ran after her to prevent her from acting suicidal,she went
root_title: The Plight of a Childless Woman(Concluding part)

author: oluwatobiloba
title: All I Asked For Was The Love of a Father
body:
https://divorcingmrwrong.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/59-the-love-of-a-father.jpg
[credit](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=imgres&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwikw8fss9vVAhWBPRQKHd_zD5QQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fdivorcingmrwrong.wordpress.com%2F2011%2F05%2F18%2Fthe-love-of-a-father%2F&psig=AFQjCNG0SpqoVGTGyBs3Gi3-qpGc-2t8Ng&ust=1502960912772888)

Childhood wasn’t fun for me unlike some other kids who experienced parental care and love  . Their fathers usually brought them to school every day and I watch them scream I love you daddy as they hugged and kissed with a great smile on their face. I will look at them with eyes filled with tears as I get pulled along by my elder sister in order for us not to get late to school.

What about those wedding ceremonies we attend with my mum most times, I stand puzzled as I watch them do the father and daughter dance and I wondered if I was going to ever have the opportunity to do this with my Dad.
It wasn’t as if I did not grow up to have a father bu
root_title: All I Asked For Was The Love of a Father

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Thinking Like A Slave
body:
https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x/11/7f/1f/117f1f30d4dcb803e6c5ceb92e5098e4--the-end-mindset.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=imgres&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjAh4bem9TVAhWHZiYKHdWMC2wQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pinterest.com%2Fpin%2F149111437640570041%2F&psig=AFQjCNGXHZtKlhBWeOBu6HDJpjbZ17QizA&ust=1502713922001941)

Your thoughts determines to a large extent what happens around you, your thought has the power to control and rule over you.

It is a process of the mind that reflects in your action and your works. Thoughts can either make or break you and it has the ability to change you from being a worse individual into a better person.

# Some kings think like slave and some slaves think like kings.

The mind set of a king could either reduce him to a nobody or allow him maintain his position as the king  and the mindset of a slave as well could either let him remain as a slave or take him to the position of royalty.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: How can a dead man speak....African powers
body:
https://www.wisdomproducts.com/images/products/legacy/large/77960.jpg
[Source](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTgPHWz1R_Z9_1g16QZTyswSwkT2dCmHcWpTkY2o7wODD4nCkZK)

Africa is a very great continent with so much powers to their dispensation, it is the world's second most populous and second largest nation. 

We are usually described as the major blacks and it is believed that we use our powers to carry out different activities which might be good or bad.

Nigeria is where I can speak of properly because I am a full blooded Nigerian. 
We are usually described as the giant of Africa and truly we are, we have the powers to do good and evil.

Nigeria has so many gods as each ethnic group believes in their own god/goddess. We have over 401 dieties usually referred to as Orisa. The Yoruba community alone has a long list of gods/goddess ranging from Osun- the river goddess to 
Ogun- the ruler of iron 
Sago - the ruler of thunder 
Sopono- ruler over diseases, and so many others.

https://img.buzz
root_title: How can a dead man speak....African powers

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Sharing Real Friendship Experience_Being Thankfull.
body:
There is nothing as great as having good and valuable friends, people who want to be there for you at times when you ask or not.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/pb0uz7hqpb.jpg)

Friends can either help one to fulfill destiny or either destroy one's plan and destiny, it depends on the type of friends you have decided to keep.

Real and true friends push you forward to the actualization of your dreams, they help you at periods when you need help, they are supportive and dependable.

Fake friends are usually the opposite of the real ones, even when you tell them about your plans,they will look for every possible means to pull you down. They want  to be the only successful one so even if you die in poverty, it doesn't matter to them, the only reason why they remain your friend is because of whatever you have to offer them.


I feel really blessed to have good friends around here and beyond Steemit, we had a departmental dinner party today and my friend who happened to be a make up artist took her time to proper
root_title: Sharing Real Friendship Experience_Being Thankfull.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Water pollution
body:
Water is an essential commodity that cannot be over emphasized on, we need water for so many countless things, as a matter of fact I will not be over saying it if I make conclusions that no human could possibly exist without water because we basically need water for all that we do which includes; washing, cooking bathing, drinking and all other necessary activities.

https://waterairpollution.org/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/waterpollution.jpg
[Source](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcQjkyDUeySouUHQwS1Is9gqcfKg0Sm-DKIm-WBt0BIReO4TZ_wd8w)


There are various sources of water as well which includes; tap water, well water,stream water, lake , ocean, borehole and the likes . The source we get water from will determine to a large extent what we will use the water for although this statement might not be true as we have lots of technological facilities that has been created to enhance the purity of water, even water obtained from dirty sources will not be recognized after been treated.

It has b
root_title: Water pollution

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Picking Up an Old Bag .....Part of a Childish Trait
body:
I have heard on several occasions how some people especially ladies abandon some old stuff for new ones, you know that is just the basic idea that when you have a new and nice stuff you put the old ones away for sometime. The idea might sound childish to some of us but it is what we do consciously or unconsciously .

I remember growing up when my Mum buys me a new cloth, I will gently fold it in my box and just stare at it days after days admiring it and waiting for a perfect day to put it on, i will smile to myself when I imagine how my friends will say @oluwatobiloba has a new cloth and they will say it is really nice, I will tell my mum to get me something similar.
http://coupon-wizards.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/01/vera-bradley-bag-exchange.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjorK284cjVAhUL1xQKHVbfAHEQjRwIBw&url=http%3A%2F%2Fcoupon-wizards.com%2Fvera-bradley-bag-exchange%2F&psig=AFQjCNGhdFFZvzhZqJMbWJS635swasdaSQ&ust=1502319671412199)
root_title: Picking Up an Old Bag .....Part of a Childish Trait

title: The Plight of a Childdless Woman .....A Nigerian Story Part 4
body:
[Brief notice] I had to replace the word barren with childless, because i was corrected by an expert that there is no such word as bareness in medicine.

Monica made up her mind to get a divorce as the humiliation was just so unbearable for her, so she left the house that morning after been pushed by the second wife with her protruding belly and went straight to her car without uttering a word, she wanted to go her lawyer's office straight away but on a second thought she decided to let her friend know about the issue that has been troubling her mind.

She parked her car in front of Becky's house and steeped
root_title: The Plight of a Childdless Woman .....A Nigerian Story Part 4

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Getting Addicted to Steemit...Good or bad Omen
body:
Steemit for me is one community that has helped me in fulfilling part of my dreams and the reason why I say this is because growing up as a child I always like to write things down , and those things were things I noticed around me and I was't comfortable with , I wanted to tell the world about it, I wanted to know what their opinion was , was it alright with everyone, is it a normality or an abnormality? . All these were questions I wanted to have answers too and most importantly hear people's opinion about it too.

I remain ever grateful to @Gbenga for introducing me to the wonderful Steemit community as I find it as a stepping stone to the actualization of my dreams, now I can write on a topic and I can read other people's view on the topic.

# Why I think I am getting addicted to the community.
 
 I was hospitalized some days ago because I was down with typhod and malaria, it was so serious that the doctor had to place me on drip and while I was on drip, I asked my mom to pass me my phone and I started u
root_title: Getting Addicted to Steemit...Good or bad Omen

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Steemit Caused a Beautiful Re-union....Why you Need to Act with Tomorrow in View.
body:
I was excited when i saw Jikwoyi phase II. Abuja on the watts app group created by @maryfavour for Nigerian new babies on steemit, I wondered how someone might know the address to my home on steemit. But, to my surprise this great woman  had lived in our street  during her service year and we had a good time chatting about old time neighbors.

Then, I started to imagine things like what if we had an unsettled family issue back then or what if she was that wicked aunt my mum use to tell me about? all this thought made me come to the conclusion that this life is really small and it is actually in circles as what goes around comes around, the people we despise now might be the ones who will be of great importance to us later in life hence the need for character building.

# Character

 Your character is the interpretation of your thought, it shows who you really are on the inside and it determines what people will take you for, it has the power to make or destroy you and that is the more reason why you need to
root_title: Steemit Caused a Beautiful Re-union....Why you Need to Act with Tomorrow in View.

# Success

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Plight of a Barren Woman....A Nigerian Story Part III
body:
http://youthvillage.co.zw/wp-content/uploads/troubled-couple.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiso_T1hbLVAhVMlxQKHVutDS0QjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fopinionatedmale.com%2F2016%2F08%2F22%2Fare-you-serious-dude-things-men-do-that-women-hate-pt-1%2F&psig=AFQjCNF4WDRojg7UWbBFzHTNT2Zm7f4Uug&ust=1501539616022524)

Monica was really confused as she sighted her lovely  husband, she was scared and obviously shaky she tried to put herself  together and helped him into the bedroom where  she put off his  dirty and smelly clothes  and laid him down to sleep. She couldn’t sleep all through the night as her disturbed mind gave her different interpretations of what the problem might be.

http://awordywoman.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/04/frustrated-woman-opt.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjoj5bRhbLVAhXHuBQKHaGVDOQQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fawordywoman.com%2Ffrustrated-discouraged-angry

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Eating The Right Way
body:
Food, is one major factor that cannot be under valued, it is really important that as humans we eat but it is even much more important to eat in the right way.

http://www.theorangetreedaynursery.co.uk/sites/default/files/attachments/Eating%20Well.jpg
[image source](https://www.google.com.ng/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiS0-Pv-67VAhULbFAKHZa2DN8QjRwIBw&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.theorangetreedaynursery.co.uk%2Feating-well-1-4-year-olds&psig=AFQjCNG_fsklzO_Nqpm4BQ_1YjRjpsUhwQ&ust=1501433550973082)

It is really important to know that it is not just enough to eat but it is most important to eat well, we need to move our gaze from eating quantity to start eating quality.

We need to learn to consume a wide variety of food rather than just focusing on specific dietary routine all the time, some people have the mentality that they can only eat well when they have a lot of money but that is untrue because one can eat a balanced meal with less cash.


http://oldsite.healthcarerefor
root_title: Eating The Right Way

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Does Age Describe Maturity
body:
Maturity simply describes people's ability to be able to respond to environmental situations appropriately. It describes a state of being fully developed physically and emotionally.

http://refe99.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/maturity-is-not-measured-by-age.jpg
[image source](https://www.google.com.ng/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjii4XKs6zVAhUE1RQKHZoKCLYQjRwIBw&url=http%3A%2F%2Frefe99.com%2Fquotes%2Fmaturity%2F&psig=AFQjCNGjbgl5vD2U27nZuCB6_IqV3eIK6Q&ust=1501345190738540)

It is believed in most part of the world, that the aged people should be matured enough to handle situations compared with the young ones due to the fact that they are experienced and they have live longed enough to understand how life works.But, it gets really disturbing when you see some aged people act in such a manner that even a young person knows that is wrong, now the big question is; do they fail to admit that they are wrong or they simply do not just have the awareness that they are suppo
root_title: Does Age Describe Maturity

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Hard work or hard life....The choice life has got to offer.
body:
It has been observed that life is governed around the decisions we decide to make, your ability to live well or live hard is justified by the approach that you decide to take it from.

It is of no doubt that rising from the top to the bottom is not easy for someone who does not come from a wealthy or a royal family but certain decisions need to be made in order to leave the category of being poor and start living a good life. 

There are some categories of people who have the opportunity of becoming  wealthy but are not because they have decided to be lazy.

http://quotezine.wpengine.netdna-cdn.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/hard-work-quote-8.jpg
[Image source](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcSNalE3goVV1mA7Pz-Ew6c2knJffw1YXXwk_yRrksAKtJOpKtac)

I know of some people who are lucky enough to have someone open a kiosk for them in order to help them improve their standard of living, but instead of them to work hard to improve the business as well as their standard of living, they believe th
root_title: Hard work or hard life....The choice life has got to offer.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Being the girl I want my daughter to become.
body:
I see so many young ladies live their life's in a wasteful manner, destroying their future by running after things that are not of lasting benefits, breaking people's marriages and relationships and their excuse is that they want to enjoy their youthful age to the fullest and you begin to wonder if they will want thier kids to grow up and become like them. It is really sad because thier kids sometimes grow up to become like them thereby making the society more corrupt as the day goes by.

I had this room mate in my first year in the university who was a ''runs girl,as we choose to call it here (prostitute)  who specializes in dating all manner of wealthy guys, as long as you have the money, then you can do whatever you like with her, she was always going out with different people and she was making lots of money from it, she used the money to get herself expensive clothes, shoes , bags and accessories, different men with exquisite cars usually came to pick her up from the hostel at night's and to drop her of
root_title: Being the girl I want my daughter to become.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Power of a Bright smile...My experience with a stranger
body:
http://i.quoteaddicts.com/media/quotes/62/3053752-beautiful-smile-quotes.jpg
[Source](https://encrypted-tbn0.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTDFWjxKPvZ9wx2a6RFB1gha3oHXUqEt4KWqq_-EkBSMV7S_kN3)

I was not really happy today because I had so many things I should have done and I hadn't done, so many set goals impeached and other failed target as well, I got really worried and upset with my self, things are not going well with me at all so my inner being screamed with pain and anguish, at this point I had to admit that I was indeed getting frustrated.

I went out in that manner, frowning my face all day  long and with the writing on my face it was obvious that something was wrong, I was tired of wearing a bright smile to make people think that all is well meanwhile I knew within  me that  nothing was going on fine.

A stranger meet me on my way to the classroom and stopped me, I felt really angry because I was not interested in whatever he had to say, the only thing I was interested in was to find solutions to my
root_title: The Power of a Bright smile...My experience with a stranger

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Plight of a Barren Woman  .........A Nigerian Story Part 2
body:
Monica walked out of the house and she could not just keep her head straight, she slightly escaped accident while driving to her office and she sobbed quietly , arriving at the office she responded to every greeting slightly as she headed straight into her office to start the day's work, she tried to compose herself as much as she could but as much as she tried to hide it, Tina who happened to be her friend and her colleague as well knew that something was wrong, she walked straight into Monica's office to ask her what the problem was. 

Monica is a person who values secrets and family matters so she believes that whatever happens at home remains at home ,she did not tell her friend at first but after serious persuasion, she had to disclose to her friend how her mother in law has become a monster overnight because she has not been able to give her husband a child. Her friend tried to calm her down and wipe her tears because she cried as she narrated all that happened herself and her mother in law.


When Mon
root_title: The Plight of a Barren Woman  .........A Nigerian Story Part 2

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Accepting the present but looking ahead to a better tomorrow
body:
Making an head way in life is definitely not an easy task, especially if you are from a rough background like me because no one seem to know you or even care about how you feel. 
Life may definitely not be a bed of roses , it may be pretty difficult to believe in your self despite the ups and downs.
But, giving up on yourself is not an option. Quitting is not an option, committing suicide is never an option ,falling back and deciding not to try again is as well not an option so what do you need to do is the next question on your mind?
I woke up this morning and I felt blessed to have the opportunity to see another beautiful morning, I know it probably not give me what I desire but I certainly do know that the opportunity to live again is a chance for greatness.
I looked at myself in the mirror and then I said thank you to Jehovah for making me beautiful and special in his own way and I prayed for favour in every area including on my post on Steemit.
I quickly went to the market to help my mum sell some fowl
root_title: Accepting the present but looking ahead to a better tomorrow

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Plight of a Barren Woman.....A Nigerian Story Part 1
body:
Eliot and Monica loved each other so much that every body around them wished that their relationships were like that of Monica and Eliot.They got married and their wedding ceremony was the talk of the town because it was attended by great and  influential people of the society.

Some women do not like to have children for certain reasons; probably because they do not want to go through the stress of child birth, they do not want to loose their shape and for every other reason best known to them. But, this is not the case of Monica as she had started buying baby things right after her wedding ceremony in expectation of her child.

https://static.pulse.ng/img/incoming/origs4536650/6040487078-w980-h640/Depressed-Black-Woman.png

root_title: The Plight of a Barren Woman.....A Nigerian Story Part 1

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The Right Association; A Criteria For Life Improvement
body:
An association is one thing that we cannot do without in life, we need to make friends, move with people and have confidants. But, we need to realise as well that we need to be really careful with the people that we associate ourselves with because they have the power to either make or break us. 

We all want to live a good life, we all want daily life improvements, we want to get settled and we just wake up each day hoping that life gets more beautiful for us.

https://hayyakomtraining.moe.gov.ae/Contents/CH08/data/en/images/02.jpg
[image source](https://www.google.com/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwik4Pfr2Y_VAhUPY1AKHZoED_kQjRwIBw&url=https%3A%2F%2Fhayyakomtraining.moe.gov.ae%2FContents%2FCH08%2Fdata%2Fen%2F03.html&psig=AFQjCNGR8YeD6Kf7zlTwroPccp5Sgs_LcQ&ust=1500359755788551)

In my previous post, I talked about determination being a great investment but there are times that we become determined to do things and us people we move with either encourage or discourage us.
root_title: The Right Association; A Criteria For Life Improvement

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Determination.....A great investment
body:
What do you invest in?, anything profitable i guess especially if it's money related.
There are a lot of things that we need to invest in that most people are not even taking into consideration. We all want to make quick money that we forget the fact that if we do not carefully put other factors into play, we might ruin the wealth that we have acquired over time.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Focusing on the positive side of life
body:
# Do you really focus on the positive side of life?
Life can only be described by the meaning that we give to it. Life in itself has so many segments, which contains the positive and the negative part of it , but the things that happen to us when we live occur as a result of the decisions that we have made to look at life from.

http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-GsoNxjlv3N8/UNlAOf9k9AI/AAAAAAAAB78/5H1yKYV4jUg/s1600/think-do-be-positive.jpg

# Life, not always rosy
Some people have decided to believe that life is cruel to them and that life has nothing good to offer them, this might result from the fact that they probably have one challenge or the other, this group of people eventually result into becoming part of the low cla
root_title: Focusing on the positive side of life

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Are you setting your priorities right?
body:
We have different plans and activities ranging from academic to business to family and every other aspect.
We meet new people everyday, we make new friends and we split up with some people , we get over-passionate about some things that we forget that our lives should be arranged in order of importance, we are not supposed to just live anyhow if we want to obtain a profitable result about our lives.
We get really busy most times that we fail to realize that life has some beautiful things in stock for us,some people live their lives in an order of regular routine, it gets to a point that they become really tired and then frustration sets in.
It has been discovered lately that those  issues  would not have resulted into frustration if only they have been handled more carefully or if our priorities have been set really right. Some of us  really place so much importance on things that should be taken with levity or something that much stress shouldn't be placed on and we do other wise to things that should be ta
root_title: Are you setting your priorities right?

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Avoiding major life set backs
body:
Making an head way in life is definitely not an easy task, especially if you are from a rough background because no one seem to know you or even care about how you feel. Life may definitely not be a bed of roses , it may be pretty difficult to believe in your self despite the ups and downs.
But, giving up on yourself is not an option. Quitting is not an option, committing suicide is never an option ,falling back and deciding not to try again is as well not an option so what do you need to do is the next question on your mind?
http://empowermentandpurpose.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/coach-business-success-empowerment-coaching.jpg

What you need to do is to:
(1)  Put yourself in order, believe in yourself because if you don't nobody will believe in you.
(2) Say to yourself everyday that you are an hero, you deserve the best and nothing but the best.

(3) Learn to set your priorities right, endeavour to put hard work before pleasure and not pleasure before hardworking. No lazy man achieves good success.
(4)
root_title: Avoiding major life set backs

body:
I have discovered over time that most relationships get destroyed because each person wants to always feel right and safe, nobody wants to look stupid so what we do is that we fight and argue over it, we fight with each other, we keep malice for a long period of time and finally, the relationship gets scattered or destroyed and that just marks the end of all that we have tried to build over the weeks, months and even years.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Is the Igbo story of creation the real story of creation?-African Myth
body:
# IGBO
The igbo's are one of the largest ethnic groups in Nigeria,The Igbo homeland consists of the lower Niger River, east and south of the Edoid and Idomoid groups, and west of the Ibibioid (Cross River) cluster.They have beautiful attires and very interesting cultural history.

http://www.africabusinessworld.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/06/Queen-Nwokoye-1.jpg
[image source](https://www.google.com.ng/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiGsfWGgf7UAhUBAZoKHSTZBvMQjRwIBw&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.biafranewsspot.com%2Fdiaspora-igbo-women-leaders-embrace-igbo-language-cultural-preservation-festival-baltimore-maryland-aug-5-7%2F2016%2F07%2F21%2F&psig=AFQjCNEi7tbI95bD_pZ1lePv_Dt_Rjj1CA&ust=1499751179041473)

# The creation story of the igbo's 

The Igbo's believe that the heaven and the earth and everything created therein was created by Chukwu. They believe that all went well in heaven for a very long time, all the gods and goddess lived together peacefully in one place. But, as time w
root_title: Is the Igbo story of creation the real story of creation?-African Myth

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Sounds local..... but certainly delicious and nutritious ( Nigeria local meal)
body:
Pap, as we call it here in Nigeria, is a special corn made meal  which could be either white or yellow. It has a distinctive sour taste that makes it irresistible. The raw pap is sold in wraps at the market and it has to be processed with hot water before it becomes consumable.

![IMAG0338.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmWkk9jhvc4AbdeegibCPvkSgnQnMESGLZ1Kbcy2CYJ6ZK/IMAG0338.jpg)
   the picture above displays how hot water is added to the raw pap.

The Igbo’s in Nigeria call it 	Akamu ,while the yoruba’s call it Ogi.

Pap could be served with bean-cake, beans and even snacks such as pof-pof, buns and the likes.

![IMAG0342.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmXQi8yyaFDtv7BtJnForV29YopcD86kVdKdfvH4xCxVYu/IMAG0342.jpg)
the picture above shows how i combined mine this morning......it was so delicious.

# Just in case you don’t want to get the raw pap from the market, you can make it yourself, the process is really easy.
    Just follow the steps below:
(i)	Soak your corn for about one or two nights for fermentati
root_title: Sounds local..... but certainly delicious and nutritious ( Nigeria local meal)

author: oluwatobiloba
title: GRACE......(God involved in the race of Man)
body:
God is an almighty, all knowing, magnificent, great and ever- loving creator. One attribute of God that never seize to amaze me is that his love knows no bound and he is ever forgiving. It is still beyond my imagination how someone will still choose to love someone who hurts him all the time.
 Despite all our numerous sins and atrocities, he still choose to love us just the way we are and he hopes everyday that we realize how much he loves us and that we love him back in return.

# GRACE
Grace is an unmerited divine assistance coming from God to man and this state is enjoyed through divine assistance.
God chooses the unqualified and makes them qualified, that is an example of  God's grace upon a man's life. His thoughts are different from ours and his ways are different from ours so the people that we feel they are not significant are those that are chosen of God to exalt.
Some of us have in one way or the other experienced grace unlimited, in ways that we do not even expect or deserve, we do not even know h
root_title: GRACE......(God involved in the race of Man)

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Will the generation of your Children curse or bless you?
body:
While growing up, I kept more to myself because i loved to observe situations around me, i was not born with a silver spoon but my Parents were contented with what they had.
We had a neighbor who was going through a really hard time,their names were Mr.and Mrs.Eze . Mrs Eze was a maid to a wealthy family whose trash were the things we considered as luxury. MRS.Eze will bring their left overs home for her kids to have something to eat. This situation continued for a long time without any help coming from any where.
There was a day that the Mr.Eze  became really ill that he got admitted at the hospital, when my Dad got there he was moved to tears because his condition was really pathetic, my dad came home to take his little savings from his small box and took it to the hospital, the savings could only get him little drugs, so my Dad advised the wife to ask for help from her rich boss to which she agreed, really trusting that her boss will be able to assist her since she had never asked her for any help before
root_title: Will the generation of your Children curse or bless you?

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Self Value- A majour tool for improvement
body:
How much worth you place on yourself will determine how far you can go in life, the only thing that has the power or ability to stop you is yourself.
If you believe that you are unstoppable, then you are and if you believe the opposite, that is exactly what happens to you.
Do not live your life based on what other people think about you or what they feel you should be.
http://wp.patheos.com.s3.amazonaws.com/blogs/searchingfortomsawyer/files/2014/01/self-esteem-and-self-love.jpg
[image source](https://www.google.com.ng/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjh6ICj9fTUAhWCXRQKHZIKAlEQjRwIBw&url=http%3A%2F%2Fsixseeds.patheos.com%2Ftimwright%2F2014%2F01%2Fthe-self-esteem-obesity-epidemic%2F&psig=AFQjCNFJsCh8QRXWrtAcii7D72rMObNOeg&ust=1499439407289609)
You do not need to feel important by proving your self worth to other people, if they believe in you, it is fine but if they don't then leave them to make their decisions.
When you learn to think positive, everything around you becomes
root_title: Self Value- A majour tool for improvement

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Is the yoruba story of creation the true creation story? - African Myth
body:
As a lover of culture, i decided to find out various cultural believes about the creation of the world(myth). I found out that there are different cultural stories about how the world came into existence both cultural and religious.
I am going to be sharing some of the stories i heard or have read with my friends here on steemit and i hope that you enjoy every bit of it.
Today i will be telling you about the yoruba cultural myth.

# The Yoruba Culture
The Yoruba's live mainly in Nigeria and majorly in the western part of the country, they believe in the worship of gods called (orisa). They have up to 400-700 gods. Some god existed before the creation of the earth, others came because they became heroes and heroines, some gods are natural objects such as mountains, valleys, rivers etc, who have their histories in the way they have saved lives in the past.
http://buzznigeria.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/yoruba-people1.jpg
[image source](https://www.google.com.ng/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad
root_title: Is the yoruba story of creation the true creation story? - African Myth

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The beauty of motherhood
body:
Real mothers are incomparable because they are sacrificial, strong,bold,courageous and independent. Their home is a place you will always want to run to for cover, their arms are usually open to friends, families and even strangers. They have the capacity to always wear a bright and smiling face even when all hope seem lost.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/2e2okwopf6.jpg)

This is the perfect description of this wonderful woman who celebrated her 50th birthday on Sunday. We flopped the church because we wanted everyone to know that this woman is simply amazing and I think that is the joy of motherhood when you watch those that you natured celebrate you just the way you deserve it.

 ![image](https://img.esteem.ws/kt7w4n9qp7.jpg) 

To this wonderful mother I say a big happy birthday to you and I wish you more colorful years to come.
To all the real mothers I wish you long life that will guarantee the joy of motherhood.
Thanks for taking out time to read my post. You can up vote, comment and restem @oluwatobi
root_title: The beauty of motherhood

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Dissapointment with recent technologies related with the bank (personal experience)
body:
My experience today was not really a pleasant one, i left home for shopping because i needed to re-fill the house with food stuff, my day was properly planned, i knew the time i wanted to spend at the market because i still had lots of arrangement to do to my room.

![IMG-20150612-WA0001.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmWBdqoWPjHPx7RshMisWMmHXqkCe8JgQoC9EMnKKsBXs6/IMG-20150612-WA0001.jpg)

I set out of the house at around 11:00am and headed for the nearest ATM machine which unfortunately was not dispensing , i waited there for some time with the hope that it might eventually get filled with money by the bank, but that was just a waste of time because it did not still dispense cash even after 30 minutes ,considering the fact that our market women here no nothing about POS (point of sale) machine, i had to go to the nearest bank and to get there will cost me all the cash i had on me.
I decided to go to the bank with the hope that i will be able to withdraw and get transportation to get to the market and as we
root_title: Dissapointment with recent technologies related with the bank (personal experience)

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Self pity (A major tool of destruction)
body:
I have had series of encounters of people who think that they should show the world how unfortunate they are by always carrying sad faces around....They believe that by doing this people will want to assist them by giving them money or render some sort of assistance,  but i have realized over time that people like this do not get a lasting solution to their problems, they are usually inflicted with pain and sadness, the people that even try to assist get frustrated at the end of the day.
 People who have self-pity believe that they have suffered too much beyond faith and there is no hope for them anymore thereby resulting into laziness because they believe that they cannot be relevant in the society.

 Self pity can destroy one's spirit , ego and believe.

https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-3YSKn5ujc94/WDDClcafqKI/AAAAAAAAKvE/mzPg3VHGhcc_g97WYdDVL00M3aNRgUsigCLcB/s1600/83968f12c3ddcb0d6e2150ddfa934291.jpg

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Something to do to get recognized on steemit (A letter to the Dolphins and Whales)
body:
Steemit is a social platform that pays you for your ideas, it helps you achieve those things that you thought you could not achieve, this and many more sweet words were things we were told before we started steeming, every day we keep thinking of new ideas,we look for every possible means to subscribe and sometimes even go hungry to subscribe (since we are not financially buoyant).

We write our hearts out with the hope that our hard work pays off, we dream and we pray that our post gets the attention of some dolphins and whales even if it is just one of them......But it seem as each day pass by, our best is not good enough, no one knows that people like us even exist on steemit.

We read people's post that talk about perseverance and hard work and then we feel maybe our best is not good enough, so we read the post of experienced people on steemit, we try to write like them and the result is still the same.  we drop comments with the hope that we will get attention but all to no avail.

Our friends see us al
root_title: Something to do to get recognized on steemit (A letter to the Dolphins and Whales)

author: oluwatobiloba
title: All the time you have left
body:
Days rolled into weeks, weeks into months, months into years..... and Florida kept on having the intention that she still had the time to make necessary amendment in life, she felt that she still had plenty of time to apologize for the wrong things that she has done and the miss-treatment that she had given to the members of her family.
Florida was a beautiful and attractive lady who believed that she could get whatever she wanted through her beauty, she manipulated things without being caught, was an expert in deceit, was very good at breaking people's homes because she was really good at making married men feel that they had made the wrong choice and they in turn get tired of their wives.
She was an expert in making young and innocent children fatherless and even their wives widows when the men come back to their senses and realize that the lady (Florida) that they have willed all their life to was no where to be found thereby resulting into an heart attack.
http://actg.org/sites/actg.org/files/SMARTNewsle
root_title: All the time you have left

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The will power
body:
The only thing that has the power to limit a man is his will,  this was the powerful statement made by my old time friend today that got me thinking. 

I realized that those things I wanted to achieve and was unable to achieve was my fault,  if only I had applied the power of will I would have been able to achieve the unachievable. 

A will means to act decisively on one's desire,  which implies that it is not good enough to think or have ideas the most important thing is to act on it. 
Your will describes your inner drive. 

The first step to the activation of will Power is self discovery.  Know that you are bold,  you are strong,  you are unstoppable and you are unique. 

http://wellspiritconsulting.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/06/Willpower-2.png

The basic hindrance to the activation of will power is fear,  when you begin to doubt,  when you think that your dreams are too big to come to reality.  Then just pause and tell yourself that to fear means to fail.  Activate the will power within you. 

Go for you
root_title: The will power

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Good Deeds
body:
One basic question we should ask ourselves as humans every passing day is if we have done anything good to humanity, if we have added joy to someone else life, if we have given anyone a reason to live again, if we have given anyone an opportunity to smile.
______
Let this basic life questions run through your mind everyday as you learn to live each day to the fullest.
------
Do not get carried away with the fact that  you are living well and forget that God has blessed you so that you could be a source of blessing to someone else.

It doesn't really need to be money sometimes, it could just be a little care, nice spoken words admits other good things.
Yes, God has bless

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The perfecter of all things
body:
There are times in our lives when you feel like all hope is lost, you feel worthless, hopeless and finished.
 Those periods when friends desert you, when even your families believe that you are a failure.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Keeping your faith
body:
Faith is one basic factor that should not be overlooked. It is your decision to believe in what you want to believe in, your right to your own version of the truth.
_____
It is no news that it is pretty difficult for people to keep their faith in this generation that is filled with so many things that might want to pull one down.
Peer pressure is one basic factor that distracts people. People get carried away by what their friends have to say about a particular situation before they take necessary actions.
_______
https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/236x/f3/7f/c8/f37fc813efe15b37af9f9b91558c74b9.jpg

I believe that everyone has the right to make necessary decisions as long as he or she is matured enough to walk that path,the right to live the way

author: oluwatobiloba
title: An healthy self esteem
body:
There is a popular saying that if you do not believe in yourself, no one will believe in you, which is very true because you have to show to the world what you want their perspective to be about you.
_______
Self believe is a basic factor that should not be underrated in our society because if you do not believe in yourself then be rest assured that no body else will believe in you.

Take steps to reassure your self everyday that you are the best and no one is like you, even if everything around you seem like the opposite of what you believe, do not quite and do not doubt, keep trusting and keep believing.
------

Self believe makes us do things that seem impossible.

Sometimes, the people that are supposed to encourage you are even the ones who makes you feel discouraged the most, that is why you need to understand that the only factor that can stop your success is you. That moment you start doubting if you are good or not then you are on the path to  failure.

Even your best of friends do not want you to b
root_title: An healthy self esteem

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Friendship that matters
body:
As time goes by, seconds turn into minutes, minutes into hours, hours into days, days into weeks, weeks into months and months into years, we should as well realize that we need to set priorities to some things about our lives.
Friends are people who can stand by us through thick and thin, friends are really important spices of life (but that is only when we find the right ones).
________
http://www.goodlightscraps.com/content/friendship-scraps/friendship-15.jpg
[source](https://www.google.com.ng/url?sa=i&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=images&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwiGvKf88LDUAhXKPFAKHTOwAekQjRwIBw&url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.goodlightscraps.com%2Ffriendship-2.php&psig=AFQjCNE1uhJuebrO-g8o-Gp6BI04Ko4hlw&ust=1497101380889863).

When we find true friends, it is as if we have found our better half or our soul mate, we have someone that we can share ideas, feelings and emotions with.
 A true friend inspires, grooms and loves for real.
Personally, i am of the opinion that anyone who does not value you should not be valued
root_title: Friendship that matters

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Taking responsibility
body:
It is very necessary as individuals to know how to take responsibilities for important events.
Does it seem like everyone around you is seeming very lazy or reluctant to carry out that task, then that means that you should do it, personally i think it gives you some sort of confidence.
https://quotefancy.com/media/wallpaper/3840x2160/2941-Winston-Churchill-Quote-The-price-of-greatness-is-responsibility.jpg

Some individuals always love to hide beneath their shell and they  forget the fact that the creator has placed them where they are to carry out one responsibility or the other.

author: oluwatobiloba
title: My tradition, my pride
body:
In an appreciative mood; my friends and i are feeling very grateful to God for how far he has brought us, he has been a faithful God despite our unfaithfulness.
______
It has been discovered majorly that Nigerians are known for celebration especially those in the southern part of Nigeria!
____
Our musical instruments are very amazing and unique, i can assure you that you cannot hear the sound of our drum and not move your body.
______
 And our food, oh la la you cannot taste it and not ask for more, have you tried amala with gbegiri or ewedu, it's so amazing.

I feel so privileged to be a part of this beautiful people with lovely attires and amazing culture.
This pictures are some of the pictures i took with friends at a thanksgiving service,  feeling really blessed in our cultural attires and giving all glory back to Jehovah.!

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The real meaning of maturity
body:
Maturity to me  is when you have the ability to handle situations the right way, when you are able to stand by the words that proceed out of your mouth, when you do not necessarily make noise about things that you should not make noise about, when you know when to be quite and when to speak.
______
Maturity is not even a matter of age and class, it is so disheartening to see members of 'high class' and 'appreciable ages' acting in obviously immature ways.
http://cdn.careandgrowth.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/maturity.jpg
----
Personally, i believe that anyone who falls into one of this categories is really not matured;
-------
 (1)  Anyone who claims to be matured and cannot even tolerate the people that they claim to love.
 (2)  Anyone who cannot handle simple and logical situations by his or herself.
 (3)  Anyone who cries to his or her parents at every slight opportunity.
http://refe99.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/09/Maturity-NapoleonHill.jpg
 (4)  Anyone who lies (cannot stand by his or her word).
 (5)
root_title: The real meaning of maturity

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Facing your fears
body:
I have come to the realization that in life one needs to learn to just accept some things the way that they come, stop being scared of what will happen if you try to control that bad attitude that you are addicted to or conquer that evil.
____
Just pause, think for a moment and run along to face and destroy it, it is very easy and simple ,the only reason why you do not understand it's simplicity is because you have not attempted it.
_____

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Being impactful
body:
One experience that is worse than death is when one's absence is felt in his or her presence, which implies that you are of no importance to that environment or gathering.

 I am of the opinion that wherever you are, your presence should be made known and it should be for a positive impact. The way we live, move, walk should be things that are worth emulating.

You should be someone that everyone will want to hear speak and emulate. Your life should be filled with peace, sincerity, joy and love.
https://authoritywrites.files.wordpress.com/2015/12/memory.jpg?w=560&h=484

(1) Improve your life style by ;
(a)   Reading books.
(b)  Move with positive minded people

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Honesty
body:
Honesty is one important factor that has been overlooked in our contemporary society. Dishonesty has become the order of the day and a normality in the society.It is now odd to speak the truth or when you even speak the truth, you are seen as been over spiritual. 
Although, i feel that there are so many reasons why people tell lies but no matter what situation we find ourselves, we should try to remain truthful  no matter what it might cost us (personal opinion anyways) , the beginning of corruption is when one starts telling lies.
Another level of dishonesty is when you cannot even tell yourself the truth, that implies that you deceive yourself and others as well.
http://www.jimknaggs.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/02/honesty_by_brambo92-d3yhs0o-300x240.jpg
My point is that humans should learn to be truthful to each other and most importantly to themselves, it begins from the home which is the smallest unit of life, be sincere with your partners, your kids and friends.
https://s-media-cache-ak0.pinimg.com/736x
root_title: Honesty

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Matters of the heart
body:
It is believed that the heart is where love resides, it controls our feelings and emotions.
The heart is a powerful instrument,but one question that usually gets me startled is if we have we have the ability to control our hearts or not.
https://themangogroove.files.wordpress.com/2016/10/8891a24e9aa93d4c59d4d8794f23c027.jpg
 But, as a matter of personal opinion, i think we just need to be more sensible about the things that we blame our hearts for. Our hearts should not always be left alone to take decisions, our brains should also function .
People should learn not to always allow their emotions rule over their brain, let's get smart, sensible and reasonable.
The fact that your heart wants to remain fixed to that guy or lady should not determine your inability to ignore your brain that is telling you to ''flee'' from that abusive and insulting relationship
Let's get smart. Let your brain rule along with your heart.
You can up vote, resteem and follow to view more post @ oluwatobiloba.
root_title: Matters of the heart

author: oluwatobiloba
title: JEOVAH JIREH
body:
God has prepared certain things for his children even before our  existence, he is our maker so he knows specifically what we need at each point in our lives.The reason why most people do not know that God has great things in stock for them is because they have refused to walk closely with him.
 As we learn to walk closely with God he reveals secret things to us that we have no idea about that they exist.
http://media-cache-ec0.pinimg.com/236x/95/8b/1f/958b1f3120cecbdf372644f7c6bdab82.jpg
God is able to provide our daily needs, provision is what we do not work for but God reveals or gives to us.
It is a life of obedience, faith, worship and total yieldedness to God's word that brings us to a place of closeness with him and also makes him reveals secret things to us.
http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-asF0x438Tz0/UBog1klWNXI/AAAAAAAAASI/0nrPLkfVnLA/s1600/9-Jehovah-Jireh.jpg
Keep trusting, keep believing. God is faithful
root_title: JEOVAH JIREH

author: oluwatobiloba
title: overcoming procrastination
body:
Procrastination is simply an act of planning to do later, what you ought to do now. It has a very bad habit that has consciously or unconsciously crept into the lives of many and is destroying them slowly prior to their own observation.
 Procrastination is what gives birth to laziness, it puts one in a tight position and then you keep thinking that you have all the time in the world to do that which you were supposed to do immediately when it crossed your mind.
Some basic ways to stop this bad attitude known as procrastination is ;
 To admit that it is a bad habit that you have grown with over the years and be ready to have a change of heart.
Tell your friends to watch you and caution you whenever you are it again.
Make a list of all you want to achieve daily and o stick to it
Have necessary punishments that you plan to give to your self whenever you default.
Be principled and self disciplined.
root_title: overcoming procrastination

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Do you believe in miracles
body:
Miracles do happen and i am a great believer in impossibilities becoming possible. Sometimes we find ourselves in situations that look so tight and hard and we our self know that there is possibly no head way using our own terms but somewhere along the line something unexpected just shows up  even beyond our imagination and our thought, that is my definition of miracles.
http://www.lovethispic.com/uploaded_images/111567-Miracles-Happen.jpg
Although, so many people do not believe, but miracles still do happens even if we do not want to admit that it was God's handwork . One amazing characteristics about this our creator is that he is ever forgiving, he forgives speedily once we have the sanity to ask him for forgiveness and he still performs miracles each and everyday to both the sinners and the godly.
http://www.amyreesanderson.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/miracles.jpg
I don't know what you believe in, or what you want God to do concerning that situation that you find yourself in,  just know that;  
M

author: oluwatobiloba
title: The purpose driven life
body:
*A purpose driven life is a life with focus and direction, it makes one stay concentrated, when you know what your purpose of existence is then you will not be a little wanderer on earth, you live bearing in mind that your purpose is what God wants from you.
Therefore, you will live everyday of your life fulfilling that purpose and it is usually very interesting because although it seem boring to others, it is usually what you love to do,

author: oluwatobiloba
title: Starting small
body:
Most of us have really high goals and objectives, things we want to do with our lives or should i just say our goals. Most of us that are entrepreneurs have big dreams and visions in our minds, but with all this plans in view, it is very important that we learn to start small.
https://static1.squarespace.com/static/56708af30e4c110e42b3829b/t/577c368335a11a9b5df53b12/1467929805375/Starting-Small.jpg
Always remember that you can begin something with the little you have and then growth begins.
Starting small is an essential ingredient for growth, those who learn to start small become great people.  But while starting small, we should learn not to be discouraged, we should persevere and always remember that quitting is not in the dictionary of winners. Do have a wonderful Sunday.
root_title: Starting small
